Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my Panasonic DMC-FX3S 6MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver), which developed spots in the lens.This Canon model is compact and cute. The color is nice. But compared to the Panasonic model, ease of use is not as good and quality of pictures is disappointing. The main things I'm disappointed with:1) erasing a bad picture requires too many button presses. On the Panasonic, there's one button to "trash" the picture. On the Canon, you have to go through three extra button presses. When you're shooting pictures and want to quickly discard the bad ones, this gets very irritating.2) focusing seems slower or less accurate. I'm getting lots of out of focus pictures with this camera.3) "point and shoot" picture quality has not been very good. Either because of out of focus (2), or poor automatic exposure/flash selection, it's not producing as many good pictures as several other cameras I've used.

Reviews.Title: A seriously great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Jack Parker
Reviews.Content: I researched point and shoot digital cameras under $100 for a month.  I know nothing about photography and don't own many gadgets.  But, before you decide that that automatically means my review can't mean much, hear me out.I've been wanting to start a blog and wanted to use my own pictures and videos.  I just wanted something with decent quality and was easy to use.  All of my research led me to first choose Canon over every other brand.  Then I found this camera.  It was in the under $200 category, which was more than I wanted to spend.  But, the more results I found online for this camera's videos and photos, I was hooked.  I bought it (at a Best Buy Midnight Sale for $149) and have had so much fun with it.  The first night I got it, I decided to take a walk and snap some pictures using ONLY the automatic settings.  When I came back and uploaded the images to my computer, I couldn't believe how great they looked!I went to a photography forum, posted my untouched photos, told how I just bought the camera and asked for opinions about it.  I got nothing but rave reviews about the camera and shock that the photos were my first attempt at photography.  They called them "saleable"  and I was encouraged to look into selling them.  Someone guided me along with how to do it and, guess what?  I sold them!My point is this:  I might have a little natural talent when it comes to composition, but the quality was ALL in the camera... and ONLY on the automatic settings!  Imagine what this camera can do when I learn how to use the manual settings!UPDATED ON SEPTEMBER 23, 2013:  I thought I'd pop in and let everyone know that this camera STILL works great!  I haven't had a single problem with it!  As a matter of fact, it lasted longer than my blog did!  LOL  And I never did learn how to use the manual settings because the AUTO settings have never failed me.  I bought a larger memory card for it but still don't understand why I can't record more than 10 minutes of video at a time.  I even lowered the quality of the video but that didn't make any difference.  That's my only complaint about this camera.  I can't seem to record more than 10 minutes of video at a time before the camera automatically shuts off.

Reviews.Title: Cannon camera
Reviews.Author: Customer Fred
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a 7 year old Cannon that I lost.  One reason for choosing this camera was the  special battery, as I have trouble getting "reusable" AA batteries to charge properly and hold a charge. After getting the camera and reading the directions it says to always charge the battery before each use.  I called Cannon, they said the battery continuously discharges due to constant parasitic load.  When I need the  camera I need the camera, don't have the ability to go charge the battery, so, every Sunday night I charge both batteries - VERY inconvenient.  Also instruction book says battery may deform and bulge, but it is OK as long as it will still fit in the camera - sounds like a problem to me! Second thing I noticed was that there is no view finder, this makes the camera very difficult to properly center on an object when the direct sun is at your back, as the display screen is illegible. Third item is inability to manually set the shutter speed, which eliminates the user's ability to plan and utilize specific exposures.  Camera is like most anything else today, trendy marketing - but not for anyone more than a novice.  Would not buy again!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Buy !
Reviews.Author: MsNikkiNY
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything an amateur photographer needs it to do; and I can do so without being totally overwhelmed with excessive technical buttons and extra stuff that I would never use anyway.  The battery life is long and the pictures are very crisp and clear.  It has great auto flash capabilities and the menus are user friendly and easy to follow.  Would definitely buy another one of the same. (The reason I wanted this model, was because my previous camera died, however I had just purchased a new battery charger and batteries; so /i wanted to make sure that the model I bought would be compatible with the canon-type battery NB-4L...In fact, there are many that do take that battery anyway, so it was a matter of finding the best bang for my buck and I am totally thrilled with the entire process from Amazon's site, to the seller, the shipment, arrival and the actual product itself....I couldn't be happier...Now, if only the cost of gas would go down...LOL

Reviews.Title: one drop and the screen is gone
Reviews.Author: nobody "nobody"
Reviews.Content: Just one drop from 2 feet for my 3 months old Cannon, and the screen is gone (actually half of it goes blank forever).I used to own another ELPH. I had dropped it countless times, and it continued to work just fine.This new design is fragile.It is time to give other brands a try.

Reviews.Title: Best Canon pocket Camera ever owned !!
Reviews.Author: Sherif Mageed
Reviews.Content: I have to give this review a 5 star but it deserve a 100 stars. I bought one for myself and after I saw how awesome of quality it was I had to buy 3 more for family.PROs:1.The Colors are so vivid and brilliant.2.In auto mode the advanced ELPH processor determines the best setting for the scene and brings out colors and lighting I didn't notice in person.3. Light and slim with ample zoom for a pocket camera.4. The anti vibration (shake) works very well especially at night5. The NIGHT MODE on this camera truly brings out the subject in front of you and the background with great clarity and vivid colorsCONs:Honestly don't really have any to say about this canon productThe new ELPH models have a 5x zoom versus this 4x zoom but that didn't stop me from buying this model numerous times for the price it's at.Happy Shopping and i hope this review helps you with your decision making.

Reviews.Title: Excellent small sized P & S - perfect backup to my DSLR.
Reviews.Author: willy
Reviews.Content: This Canon Elf 100 HS is my first ever point and shoot, as I have only owned DSLR's and (before that) 35 mm.  It is a perfect take with you(in your pocket or a small belt case), just to get the shot type of small camera.  It is advertised as a no frills just takes good photos, and that's exactly what I am receiving in currently.  Favorite things are 1)good low light shooting, also 2)the face recognition, and 3)easy to understand menus, 4)relaively low price.  It is a welcome addition to backup my Nikon DSLR. I am  content with its small button controls, and it hits the spot for family outings or any time a larger DSLR might not be appropriate to carry.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: sun_muse
Reviews.Content: This little camera was very affordable, has a lot of fun features I wasn't expecting (try the miniaturization and fisheye ones!) and was perfect in a pinch.  My husband has a very nice, very unwieldy camera.  I just wanted a camera to take pictures of scenery and friends while on vacation.  Couldn't have asked for better.  Thanks, Canon for creating such great products!

Reviews.Title: tears to cheers - ELPH survives a dip in the pool!
Reviews.Author: Harold Kyriazi
Reviews.Content: Got this for a girlfriend just before taking a vacation in Jamaica.  It works wonderfully (well-designed and engineered, rapid turnaround time, nice zoom stabilization, good color reproduction, good flash, convenient battery charger), and fits nicely in a small case I also got here at Amazon.  The remarkable thing is what happened after she dropped it accidentally into a very shallow part of a swimming pool and it stopped working (I think she shorted the battery when, against my advice, she immediately tried to turn it on after its 2-second swim).  By removing the battery and flash card, and leaving the camera with the battery/flash card compartment open in a sealed moisture-proof bag with dry rice, after a couple days of drying out it worked again perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Simple, Practical, and Beautiful Pictures
Reviews.Author: jaiap
Reviews.Content: I originally bought the Canon 300 HS, which I adored, but it broke so I got the 100 HS instead. I've had no problems with it so far. It takes great pictures and is easy to use. With the current price, it's a definite steal for such a great camera.

Reviews.Title: My friends ask me how much I paid...
Reviews.Author: Morgan
Reviews.Content: My friends ask me how much I paid for this camera, and when I say $109, they think I'm joking. It has a million different photo options ranging from snow mode to fireworks mode. The 1080p video looks beautiful apart from the slight de-sync from the top to the bottom of the frames, but I have come to the conclusion that this may be unavoidable in point-and-shoot cameras. The low light video capabilities of this camera surprised me, and the noise reduction on the photos is very good, making everything look nice, although sometimes a bit soft.The camera is very small and light, but packs a huge punch in performance.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader "Betty"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera as a birthday gift for our daughter.  It's simple to use, easy to hold, and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Replacement!
Reviews.Author: Husain
Reviews.Content: This cannon is the replacement for Canon PowerShot SD1100IS. I think I made a great choice. I extremely recommand it to anyone looking for simple yet fancy camera.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money
Reviews.Author: K Fino "Stay Home Mom"
Reviews.Content: This is my third (and last) Canon. The first one I had was awesome, and I keep trying to find that same satisfaction with this brand. This latest camera did not take great photos. I notice they are darker, it has more trouble auto-focusing and it's just disappointing. This is my third Canon to break since 2009. The first one I got a couple years of use out of, the second one only about a year. This one I had for 6 months, and now the lens won't shut. I have to send it to Canon (at my own expense) before the one year warranty runs out. In the meanwhile, I bought a Panasonic and I'm much happier with it. Would not recommend Canon to anyone anymore.

Reviews.Title: Just like my old Ixus
Reviews.Author: Pipigurl
Reviews.Content: My 4-year old Canon Ixus 80IS finally gave up the ghost late last year (after dropping it on the floor many times) and I've been hunting for a good deal on cameras ever since. Unfortunately, I couldn't find the Ixus model here in the US. I researched online and found out that its US equivalent is Powershot ELPH 100 series. I waited (around 6 months) for the price to drop to $102 and then I grabbed it. It's well worth the wait! The pictures are exactly like my old one used to make plus there's quite a number of new features. The body is also thinner, sleeker and lighter which is great! It also uses the same battery as my old one so now I have a backup battery. I have yet to try the HD video and I haven't bought an SDHC card. I tried my old regular SD card, though, and it works fine so far for photos.For $102 this camera is truly a steal! I remember I paid over $300 for the old Ixus back in 2008.

Reviews.Title: A decent camera
Reviews.Author: James D. "Tech, Mech, and DIY"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my girlfriend as a backup. She has a Canon T2i, but having to always lug around a DSLR cameral is a drag.She loves having this for just going out and snapping photos for day to day types of things.The camera is pretty quick to turn on and be ready to shoot.The battery life seems to also be very satisfactory.The optical zoom is a nice feature, and works well. Digital zoom is useless and is just a marketing gimmick for all manufacturers.If you would like to manually set up shots, this camera allows you to do so to some extent, but I think the nice thing about this is its ability to be set on "auto" and take decent shots.Pretty durable. I think she's dropped this a few times, and it still works fine.All in all, it's a decent camera for an ok price. My girlfriend swears by Canon and refuses to go elsewhere, otherwise, I probably could have found something just as good from another brand for a better price.

Reviews.Title: Great! Although a bit confusing...
Reviews.Author: Haylee
Reviews.Content: I could tell when I got this camera that it was a quality one, however I didn't fully understand a lot of the functions for a long time and I still don't understand them completely. If you are a camera expert, not like myself, you would probably have no problem navigating this camera and be able to take very cool shots with it!To those of you who are debating between buying this camera and the Canon PowerShot SD1400 IS Digital elph (you might know it better as, "the one that costs fifty bucks more") there is about one difference as far as I can tell. I own both camera models, and my fifty dollars more camera takes videos while the other one does not. If videos are important to you with your camera them I heavily suggest spending the extra fifty because the video quality is absolutely amazing.As for THIS product, great buy! A photographers handy tool.

Reviews.Title: Canon Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Capt. Mike
Reviews.Content: Consumer Reports rated this the best camera in this price range and I would have to agree. I have not had the time to use as much as would like but very satisfied so far.

Reviews.Title: Great Night-time Pictures
Reviews.Author: A.Buuren
Reviews.Content: This is a great point n shoot camera; easy to use; fast auto focus action; and takes really good nighttime pictures - exactly what I was looking for around $100.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot a good deal for the price
Reviews.Author: Steph
Reviews.Content: I needed a no-fuss point and shoot camera that could take good photos without me needing to mess with the settings. The auto feature is pretty decent on this camera and will take good photos. The screen is huge and takes up most of the back face. I love the cheery bright orange color. Overall it is a good buy. The one thing I would fix is that there's a delay between taking photos, which could be due to my memory card. Though the photos aren't amazing, they are solid for what it is.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - for video and pictures
Reviews.Author: SP
Reviews.Content: I own a few cameras, and my boyfriend is a professional photographer.  We recently returned the go pro in exchange for this one. The video quality is amazing, and pictures too.  If you look at your images on a large HD tv - you'll really see a difference in the quality.We bought two of these for productions, and plan to buy a case for underwater photos.  Great price for a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great on the go camera
Reviews.Author: college traveler
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera for a 9 month trip to Asia. So far I am only one week in but the camera has been everything I wanted both pre-departure and abroad. The size is small enough that I can throw it into my pocket on my way out of the door which is convenient since last time my host took me on a 'walk' we ended up being gone for hours and visiting a bunch of interesting sites. The build is also substantial enough that I don't have to worry about it falling apart. The special camera features are fun to play with (I like the color select) but I love the auto setting because there are times when I need to take the camera out and take a picture right away. It is easy to take quick, good quality (for not being DSLR) pictures. I'm no camera expert but this camera has been great.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Gypsy Dancer
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. I had a Canon 6 MP and wanted to update to a 12 MP or higher and I wanted to stay with the Canon brand so I checked out what they had. This little camera just stood out for me. The first thing that attracted me was the color, but that aside, it does great in low light, just like it says and you can choose to shoot totally automatic or switch it over to manual and either choose one of the preset shooting modes or just adjust your own settings. It has a great 3" viewing area and the controls are very similar to my old Canon so it was pretty easy to move over to this one. I find myself grabbing more for this one now, than my old one. It takes great pictures and I like that I can use the larger storage memory cards. The handle is about the only thing that they could have done better on. My old camera has a nice, flexable, soft handle with a sliding part where you can make the handle opening larger or smaller. This new one has a stiffer, vinyl like handle with no adjustment for the opening. It just seems a bit cheeper to me, but the camera itself is amazing. If you want a camera that will do it all for you, this is great for that. I am very satisfied with it's quality and the quality of the pictures it takes. Canon is a good brand.One note: it does not come with a memory card so I had to buy that separately. It does come with the battery and the battery charger, as well as the software though.As usual, Amazon did a great job with the whole transaction. Camera arrived safe and sound within a reasonable time.

Reviews.Title: ONLY ONE DRAWBACK - SHORT BATTERY LIFE
Reviews.Author: tczig
Reviews.Content: I am a Canon girl and I like this little camera; it takes good, sharp pictures.  But, beware -- the battery life is very short.  I shoot in a setting that makes the largest pictures and I can only get about 400 - 450 pictures.  That's without any video use at all!  I have been several places and have had the battery go dead.  Either buy a spare or find a camera with a longer battery life.  (Maybe if I set the picture size lower, the battery would last longer - but I like the full size pictures, so I haven't tried that.)Other than that, this is usual great Canon quality. It's very small, has a big, very nice, screen in the back.There is no viewfinder, only the screen.  My previous little Canon had a viewfinder; but, most little pocket cameras don't have that.  That takes getting used to if you use an SLR with a view finder.I would have rated this 5 if the battery lasted longer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: JS
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera, and it is purely a point and shoot camera.  Photos are consistently good, saturated, and accurate.  It fits easily in any pocket.  While this is a camera, I also found the movie mode great if your trying to catch movies here and there, like a birthday party, etc.  If zoom is important to you in movie mode, please note that it does have zoom, but it's digital zoom--not optical.  Redeye is generally not a problem and there's redeye removal in the camera (in addition to your software): remember this is a point and shoot camera, so that's a good thing.  Lastly, one of the features I think is handy is the i-Contrast feature which is designed to increase overall contrast.  At times, there's a slight increase in noise with i-Contrast, but you can turn it off (and you can apply it in playback mode at different leves, auto, low, medium, and high).  For the price, I think most people will like this camera, and especially love it if you are looking for a camera that you can take any where to catch those moments.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ben "Ben"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent little camera.  In many situations, it takes pictures of comparable quality to my Rebel XS.  The optical image stabilization puts it solidly above most point-and-shoot cameras I've used.I bought this because it's just about the smallest real camera I could find, and I wanted something I could easily carry with me.  The only drawback to this is that the buttons on the back are quite small and can be a pain to use.  On the plus side, the interface is very straightforward and there's no selection wheel full of options I'll never use.  Another refreshing change from other cameras I've used is that the camera explains the significance of most settings, so even those you don't use very often won't confuse you.Video quality is also pretty good.  It'll take 1080p videos, but only at 24 frames per second, which generally looks jerky.  I much prefer the results at 720p.  Zoom and autofocus do not work during video recording, but you aren't stuck with webcam-style fixed focus, you simply have to set zoom and focus before starting to record.  I think this has something to do with the microphone picking up the noise caused by the moving parts in the lens.  You can also take slow-motion video at up to 240 frames per second, which is a neat trick - although 240fps is not always fast enough to capture a whole lot of detail you can't see anyway.

Reviews.Title: Top Rate Product
Reviews.Author: Stanley I. Levine
Reviews.Content: I have owned many cameras over the years spanning SLRs to digitals. This is the first "Instomatic", if you will, I have owned which produces a professional type photograph (image).I will endorse this camera for anyone.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Patti S
Reviews.Content: I previously had a Cannon Elph and LOVED IT! I had taken it to the beach, got sand in the lens and it never worked again.I tried another brand of camera and it couldn't hold a candle to the Elph. Returning to the Elph felt like going home again ;-)I am by no means a professional photographer so this does everything for me.  I leave the setting on "auto" and when taking pictures it adjusts itself to the proper setting.  Now I don't have to figure out what to do if I am outside in low light with a moving dog.  I just click and BAM!  A great photo!I also love the battery that comes with the camera.  Charge it for an hour it last for at least 4-5hrs.  No need to buy batteries and worry about having extras with you.  The battery charger is super compact so say you are going to a wedding and only have a clutch purse/suit jacket you could easily bring with you. Its small and super light weight.So to summarize....the camera is AWESOME!PS - I bought the camera through the Amazon store and it was shipped super duper fast and in perfect condition.

Reviews.Title: Not sure if I got a lemon but...
Reviews.Author: C. M. Graham "~cmgraham"
Reviews.Content: Even though I thought I did enough research nothing but disappointed with this camera, I am returning it. I tried working with it for a couple hours but could not get good results at all.  Poor color, everything is too bright & looks blown out, software doesn't actually work on Windows 7 even with their update. I can get better pictures with my iPhone. Camera came with a gouge on the bottom so I suspect it was returned before.

Reviews.Title: Bad for zoom shots/landscape shots
Reviews.Author: Charles Carmichael "Chuck"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera specifically to take pictures at a concert. the only pictures that came out decent were of us sitting in our seats. none of the distance shots came out, all were blurry. so now I have 12 MP blurry photos.I could have gotten the same results from my 3.2 MP 7 year old camera. If you want a small camera for close pictures with friends, this one will be fine, but most smart phones will get the same results.

Reviews.Title: Fine Camera, but Canon 300 HS is much better for video
Reviews.Author: H Zuka
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to replace my Canon SD780 IS, which was a nearly perfect travel and main video camera until the day it stopped focusing.  Based on the reviews it looked like the Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS would be the perfect replacement.The body of the 100 HS is plastic, which made it feel inferior to the SD780, but the pictures it took looked great.  To me the real shortcoming was with its video. In HD it can only shoot at 24fps and quick movements produced a trippy distortion (not sure if it was a lens issue or an fps issue) that did not look as natural as my old SD780, which shot HD at 30fps.I've since bought a 300 HS for about $50 more and could not be happier with it, as it has a metal body, can shoot HD video at 30fps, can focus/ optically zoom during a video shoot and does not have the same distortion issue when shooting HD video as the 100 HS has.

Reviews.Title: Not bad but Canon has better
Reviews.Author: J. Durand
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera along with a few others to evaluate as a replacement camera for work. Overall it was a pleasant camera to use. Pictures were good, the camera handled well and construction was good.  However, in the end I returned this camera and opted instead for the Canon Elph 300hs (black), which is the next model up from this one.  This decision was guided by several factors.  First, the 300hs has a wider angle lens (24mm vs. 28mm) and this is useful indoors as it captures more of the scene.  Secondly, the 300hs is made out of metal (the 100 is plastic) and it feels extremely rigid and well built. Also the black textured paint on the 300hs is fantastic as it offers a nice secure grip. Lastly, the button placement on the 300hs was, in my opinion, better thought out than on the 100hs. Other than the differences stated above the 300hs and 100hs are very alike and would perform very similarly. However, for the small price difference and benefits listed above the 300hs, in my opinion, is a better value. That is why I returned this camera.

Reviews.Title: Inaccurate description!!!
Reviews.Author: Petes
Reviews.Content: I haven't had a new camera in some time and liked the ease of use and quality of the Canon brand. So i got this thinking it would blow me away, but it was somewhat disappointed. It's a great camera, but some photos were too washed out. The night photos were still blurry. All these advances don't seem to have made as much of an impact as i was expecting.Other major complaint. THE PRODUCT DESCRIPTION IS WRONG!!! I contacted an email rep about this and i will return the camera. The problem is that the camera DOES NOT have aperature and shutter priority modes. I also mentioned in my email that the same goes for the 300 HS product description. I only figured this out after receiving the product and going to the Canon website for their description of the features.in the end, nice point and shoot, but was expecting better. I used to love and would recommend Canon over anyone else, but i may go stray this time. Sony is looking better...

Reviews.Title: My opinion of the Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Marion Buchanan
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and understand directions.  Pleased with the quality of the pictures. This is the second time I have purchased this model. I dropped the first and chose to replace it with the same model.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Bridgette
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my mom. I have the camera that the the version before this one. This one is great and now i borrow it all the time.

Reviews.Title: Good and great price!!
Reviews.Author: Carlos nunes
Reviews.Content: For the usage I have, it was a great purchase and Canon is a very good brand.Camera has a good definition and works very well.

Reviews.Title: Perfect little hot pink picture taker!
Reviews.Author: LonelyTouristCharlotteCharles
Reviews.Content: I love it.  I love the size, the slim profile, the picture taking quality (mistakes are fixed with Picasa software), etc.  The hot pink color is great.  I've had no issues with the camera in the year or so I have owned it.  I haven't used it all that much, but I am very happy with the product.BTW, if you want a good case for this, get this leather one Canon PSC-55 Deluxe Leather Compact Case for SD430, SD500, SD550, SD600, SD630, SD700IS, SD800IS, SD850 IS, SD900,SD950IS & SD870IS 300 HS , 100 HS Canon Digital Cameras models.  It's perfectly functional, beautiful, glove-like fit so your camera won't move around and get scratched. Keep in mind, it only has room for the camera and nothing else.  The quality is unsurpassed compared to the canvas/fabric ones.  And holy cow, it's dirt cheap!!

Reviews.Title: Lens error
Reviews.Author: bk26
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera at Costco when they had a sale. The pictures came out great and I really like that you can set the timer to take 3 pictures in a row. I had it for about 6 weeks and was on a backpacking trip when it started giving me the lens error message and would not open to take pictures. I was really disappointed becasue this is the only camera I had with me.Reading other reviews I see this may be a common problem. Will call Cannon and see if they will replace it. Until I get it back I am using my old Cannon Point and shoot. Unfortunately when you zoom in for a picture it has a black mark on  the screen that transfers to the pictures. That is why I replaced it.Even if Cannon replaces it I will be worried each time I go backpacking that it will happen again. May end up buying another brand of camera.

Reviews.Title: Quality Images
Reviews.Author: Annie Wisecarver
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on my Appalachian Trail thru-hike this year so it took a bit of abuse for over 2000 miles. About two thirds of the way through it stopped working (most likely because of rainy days when it got a bit damp and being dropped a few times)and I liked the camera so much, I got another one that completed the hike with me. The camera has plenty of settings so that you can customize your picture taking and the images are beautiful. Many of my photos look like they were taken by a professional. The camera has a good size screen making it easier to see what you are about to take a picture of. The videos I took came out great as well. I recommend the camera and am still using it. I am a painter and I feel completely confident when I take pics of something I want to paint that the images are going to give me true, clear color, shape and texture. Great little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, great price.
Reviews.Author: Nicole Bauer
Reviews.Content: I wanted an easy to use camera that could handle my shaky hands. This did marvelously and really helped me record my recent vacation. The presets were fun for someone lacking professional experience and I really have issues with blurry pictures due to shaky hands. I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Emergency buy
Reviews.Author: Lory
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera ASAP for one of my summer trips and I chose this one. The pictures are AMAZING. It does not have many options for you to take the picture, but indoors and outdoors they look really good. You just need to leave it in automatic and the pictures are very nice. Easy to use and for the price the pictures are good.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Solomon
Reviews.Content: Staples had the same camera with SD card for $100 on sale the other week.  I should have waited.  The speed and quality is excellent.  For the $100 range, it's not a bad camera at all.  You can see that it is quality for everyday use.

Reviews.Title: Dissappointing camera
Reviews.Author: Mocaldoc
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife and in just a few months, it had a lens error and the lens would not come out and the camera would not function. I returned it to Canon and got a replacement under their warranty, and in less time than the first one...another lens error and a non working camera. I know Canon cameras have a bad reputation for this happening when taken to the beach, but this camera was never used outside. Guess it is Nikon or Panasonic for me from now on.

Reviews.Title: best little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: A New Yorker
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera.  Lightweight, compact, beautifully styled, feels great in the hand,  you can take it anywhere.  The picture quality is very high, and the controls are simple to use.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Failed twice within 9 months
Reviews.Author: Dewit Yerselfer "The goal is to be fair"
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed.  This camera has died TWICE (so far) and it's only been 9 months.  The first time the camera failed it would not turn on at all.  We sent it for warrenty repair and received a refurbished replacement camera THAT WAS NOT THE COLOR OF OUR ORIGINAL, Canon said we didn't have any option on which color they sent.Now, three months later and the replacement camera has just died. This time, after taking a video and attempting to shut off the camera its shutter locked up and would not close! Now when you try to turn it on you get a 'shutter error'. I'll unhappily be sending it in for warrenty repair again. Who knows what color camera they'll give me this time, Purple?  I'm disappointed on two fronts, first that the camera FAILED TWICE in nine months and second that they send you a refurbished camers and don't give you any choice in which color you recieve.  Why can't they just swap the front cover plates? Or make it so wee could do it?If the camera hadn't failed twice I'd have given it four stars, but right now my fear is that when we get a third camera it too will fail in a few months, probably after the warrenty is up, at which point there is no way I would pay for another refurbished replacement.

Reviews.Title: (A+) Great Camera for indoor photos
Reviews.Author: FAL
Reviews.Content: Photo Taking+Great indoor photos+Easy to use and simple to setup+Very fast shot to shot with flash.+Your get 50-75 shots flash and 150-200 w/o flash.+90% of photos were blur free+Good shutter button-2 sec. timer could be accessed faster/ 1sec timer is neededTips:1. Set photos to 6MP or 3MP to save space and improve speed.2. Spend $10 for the spare battery 1200-1600Mah.3. Your get 99% blur free photos with the auto timer.Video Capture+Quick video camera button+Shots in 1080p,720p,480p SD-Large file size

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: A. Horikawa
Reviews.Content: My family really likes this camera, and we use it quite frequently. We bought it about six months ago and it has held up well. Here are the pros and cons.Pros:Lightweight, fits well in your hand.Button placement makes sense.Instructions and controls are easy to understand.Very clear pictures.Decent battery life.Quick capture - which helps with a fast moving toddler!Nice looking camera, not bulky at all.Cons:Not as many features as others in its line.I'm fairly certain it would break on impact - from dropping or something like that. I always use the wrist band that it comes with.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Suz Out West
Reviews.Content: I did some research on several digital cameras and finally decided on this one.  I've always had Canon cameras as they are the best, and this little jewel made the grade as well.  I haven't used it too much but I have found it easy to use and it provides clear images.  It was also much less expensive to purchase on Amazon rather than through Best Buy.  Kudos to Canon again!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera, but pictures are not very sharp
Reviews.Author: T. Dokland
Reviews.Content: I needed a small camera for a skiing trip having forgotten my Lumix and this one seemed to fit the bill. It is a nice little camera, very compact, well made with a solid feel, and it has all the features you would expect and that most people would need. I have used it quite a lot over the past 6 months, about 1400 pictures or so. The image stabilization works well and low light performance is not bad; in fact, much better than my Lumix TZ-5. However, there are some negatives. The zoom is quite limited, but that's perhaps not unusual for a camera of this size. My main problem with the camera is that the pictures are not very sharp, even in high light situations, where the Lumix far outperforms the Canon. Obviously the Lumix has better optics, but the Canon should not be too bad, so I assume the reason for the softness is primarily a fundamental limitation of the sensor chip. For this reason I would not recommend this camera. Hopefully they will incorporate a better sensor in future versions of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera.
Reviews.Author: Brice S.
Reviews.Content: I'm not very savvy when it comes to cameras. When it comes to cameras I just need a camera that is easy to use, aims, clicks and produces a good looking photo. I have owned many cameras in my days, but this one is the easiest and best functioning one I've ever owned. It produces great looking photos, and has a decent zoom. The video has some great quality too. One beef I do have is that Canon cameras produce mov. files instead of easier to use avi. movie files, but that is a small gripe. I am very happy with this camera. I've already dropped it a few times and I haven't even seen a paint chip or loss of any function. Its small, durable and easy to use. I  fully recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good quality, Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my sister for Christmas and she loves it!  It's simple and easy to use compared to a lot of other cameras and it's not heavy at all.

Reviews.Title: "LENS ERROR" - after 420 pictures
Reviews.Author: P. Sosa
Reviews.Content: The camera is incredible at this price. Pictures and videos are very good. I bought it for a vacation trip and took about 420 pictures and some videos until the lens got stock in the open position.The message "Lens Error" was displayed on the screen.I was unable to do anything. The lens was jammed and nothing made it return to normal operation. Please note that the camera had not suffered any harsh treatment only the normal on/off operation. I had to buy another camera but this time I kept away from the Canon ELPH series.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Deepa
Reviews.Content: Battery is good for one trip. It recognizes the scene automatically (sunset,shade,flash etc...). Photo quality is fantastic (I compared most of the top brand's photo quality, no doubt... Canon gives the best photo quality. This is true for this model too).

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY---GREAT CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: southernbell "Connie Oz"
Reviews.Content: I dropped my kodak pocket camera and needed a replacement---looked and this is an older version, but still being sold--BEST CAMERA EVER!!!  Fast, easy to use and I LOVE IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: Second purchase, both great!
Reviews.Author: VN
Reviews.Content: Purchased one of these for my company, I enjoyed it so much... I got one for myself! The screen is large and clear. It's quick to save photos so I don't waste time in between pictures. It is now my primary point-and-shoot camera for when I don't want to whip out the SLR.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: BABYsmiles
Reviews.Content: Great photo quality. Came with two batteries very convienent. Small and portable. Easy to get the setting to your liking. Displays will help you with getting the best photo possible.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: ABT
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas -- she's been using for several months now and it's been working very well.  The quality of the pictures are very good, she can easily transfer the pictures to her laptop. We have been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Good quality
Reviews.Author: Qishang Mai
Reviews.Content: Canon is famous in Camera industry. The pic system is updated. There are a lot of new features. But this color is not pink enough.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: V. Collins "Gsnap"
Reviews.Content: I have owned quite a few cameras in my time and this is by far the best.  It takes sharp pictures and is ready for another shot RIGHT AWAY which is very important to me.  I have not even learned to use all the extra cool stuff it can do like fish eye lens, but it is easy to get to these options with just a little time spent.It gets an A+ in my book

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 100 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Yosemite Sam
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my Grandaughter, so other than getting it set up and ready for picture taking on Dec 25, the only pictures I actually took were as part of that endeavor.  Must say that I was pleased with my limited experience in dealing with getting it set up and the quality of the few shots I did take.  She has taken it with her on several school excursions since and never lost it, so she must be impressed enough with it to make sure it is with her at all times.

Reviews.Title: Great price for what you get
Reviews.Author: okiepharm "Dusty Allen"
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great value for all the features you get with it. I bought this for my mother for her birthday and she loves it. It was very simple for her to learn to use, and she isn't very techy. This is only her second digital camera (the other was an old kodak for about 13 years ago). She had it for about 3 days and we went over and she already had figured out how to take pictures, review them, and delete them.It has a large screen, great resolution, zooms smoothly, and it was taking good pictures in a not so well lit room.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased-Meets My Camera Needs
Reviews.Author: Magic Carl "Magic Carl"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS 12.1 MP based on its' price and the positive reviews that I read about it.  The Canon PowerShot fits my need for an easy to use and slip into your pocket stye of camera.  I am very pleased with the quality of the photos that it takes.  I highly recommend this camera for general picture taking.  It offers good quality at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: GOOD CAMERA
Reviews.Author: TALL MAN
Reviews.Content: GOT THIS FOR OUR TEENAGE DAUGHTER & SHE LOVES IT. HAS THE BIG VIEW SCREEN, EASY TO OPERATE, & SHE CAN DOWNLOAD HER PIC EZ.  WE HAVE HAD OTHER CANON POINT & SHOOT CAMERAS & LIKED THEM TOO, &  THIS ONE IS ANOTHER CAMERA IN OUR FAMILY THAT WILL GET ALOT OF USE.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Marilyn
Reviews.Content: Got this for my mother to replace a 10 year old camera that needed to be shot.  She absolutely loves it!  Super user friendly (she's in her 70's) and fantastic quality.  For the record, this is the 7th or 8th person I've talked into buying an Elph.  I think these rock.Buy it - you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: A really useful, fun camera
Reviews.Author: Rico
Reviews.Content: This camera is packed with great features and special effects. As someone who used to use film cameras, I'm still amazed by how much processing a little pocket camera like this has built in. Things like slow-motion video and diorama effects are very fun to play with.Images seem a little less punchy than from my old PowerShot A510. I think it's mainly because the ELPH 100's colors are less saturated. You can increase the color saturation in the menu settings, but the more neutral colors are more flattering in portraits.Low light performance is quite good, which is important because existing-light photos look so much more natural than flash photos. I got impressive shots in a very dimly lit restaurant by using Low Light mode and letting the camera handle the automatic white balance.The body is smooth, so it's easy to pocket. It's a bit slippery, though, so use the included wrist strap.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Tracy Nelson
Reviews.Content: Great camera. I found some of the settings a little difficult to figure out, but I spent a few minutes playing with them and I was able to get it. Great picture quality. Perfect for quick snap shots and easy to take anywhere. I haven't had any problems with the camera so far. I've owned the product for 2 months.

Reviews.Title: OMG!!! couldn't be happier!!!
Reviews.Author: Beautiful_Brenda
Reviews.Content: I had the Canon Powershot SD1100 IS since 2009, but someone stole my camera. I needed a new camera for my Catalina trip I just went on this past weekend. I COULDN'T BE MORE HAPPY with my purchase! I bought the pink one at Sammy's Camera for $109, cuz they were having a sale, or else I would've bought it on Amazon.I can't reiterate how amazing this camera is! The quality of the pics are priceless. The camera was VERY easy to use and the big screen was a HUGE plus. I've never been more happy with a Canon camera, and this is my fifth one! I havn't had good luck with cameras, but hoping this one will stick around for awhile.If you have any doubts or questions about which camera to get, this one WON'T disappoint you!!!!  For the price, size and quality, you can't complain.Thank you Canon!

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY :)
Reviews.Author: Sarah in ATX
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera especially for the price, not to mention I love the orange color. The color makes it easy to find too ! I have a Panasonic Luminix which cost 2xs more and the pics came out with peoples faces washed out no matter what setting I put it on. I did NOT like try to predict which setting would make people look normal instead super super white. But this camera takes great pictures and finds the PERFECT setting for you. It doesn't get any easier than this- all u do is point and shoot and your pics have great quality. I'm so pleased with the purchase...sometimes less is more!!!

Reviews.Title: Small, light, easy, but limited abilities
Reviews.Author: RBZ4KK
Reviews.Content: After my previous Canon died on me, I started the search fo new camera.  I've red many reviews to learn a couple of issues: un-reliablily of made in China Camera, Design issue of made in Japan camera and run out of power of GPS units. After reading these, I thought there is no perfect camera why I bother pay a lot of money, so I decided Canon Powershot 100. The camera is working so far, but I wanted to mention a couple of issues.  Indoor, the many pictures looked yellowish. Also, video is not smooth.  I did not have any high hopes for this camera,so I'm ok with it. If you are looking for a best quality camera, you need to pick something else.

Reviews.Title: Great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: M. Port
Reviews.Content: I had the predecessor to this camera and, when I felt it was ready to advance to the newer model, this was the one that I selected.It takes great pictures and the controls are easy to understand. There's also a fun 'vintage camera feature' on this one that the older version didn't have which does the vignetting around the outside edges and fisheye as well as others that's fun to play with.Like the earlier version, this one takes great photos that are easy to remove from the card, especially if you have one of those card reader slots on your computer.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: lk808
Reviews.Content: I have "fancy" cameras but, sometimes you just need a simple, easy, quick point and shoot one and so far this one fits the bill. Takes good pictures in low light which was my concern and it hasn't let me down so far.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Pmm368
Reviews.Content: This camera takes really good pictures and videos.  The quality suits my needs.Pro's:1. 1080P at 24 FPS, 720P at 30fps2. 28-120MM Wide Angle Lens, bigger than the Flip's camera.3. SDXC cards can be used4. 4X Optical ZoomCon's1. Purple objects come out blue under certain lighting conditions. It's not the Canon's screen, it shows up in videos and pictures when placed on the computer.2. Can't use Optical Zoom while recording, which was a downside for me when I got the camera.3. Flash doesn't cover everything in range.  The Digic 4 takes good enough photo's without flash, so it's not much of a con.  Keep hands steady.4. Sound is Monaural.  Was hoping for Stereo 2.0 sound.

Reviews.Title: Right camera for the right price with excellent features
Reviews.Author: Western Reader
Reviews.Content: Compact, easy-to-understand instructions, very good photo results, and just the right price. These add up to a nifty camera that's easy to tote in my handbag -- one I can whip out and easily catch that "Kodak moment." This is not a camera with a small viewfinder, so I had to learn to hold it very still when pressing the button (I was used to holding my more elaborate Minolta digital camera against my face, which made it easy to get sharp photos). I am getting better at holding still, and am very satisfied with the results.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Gearz
Reviews.Content: The pictures are great quality even in the dark and dull light.The colors are vivid and the screen is clear.The menu features are easy to use and the battery last long between charges.

Reviews.Title: best little camera
Reviews.Author: Deborah Miller
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures and is really easy to use! The price was great and we recived it very quicly. Thank you our daughter loves it!

Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: howlingmanx
Reviews.Content: My wife was starting a blog and website for her artwork and we needed a camera to take photos of the merchandise.  Not being able to afford a DSLR or anything over $200 dollars, I found that this basic type of compact camera was the best we were going to get.  I did a lot of research on this site and cnet, and had a few options in mind.  I had pretty much made up my mind to get this one when I went to Best Buy to pick it up, and the salesman confirmed my feelings.  He basically said that for a compact point and shoot, this was pretty much the best.When I got it home I couldn't have been more pleased.  I'm actually glad we didn't spend more on a fancier higher end camera, because this thing performs great for our basic needs.  It does so well on "auto" mode that I haven't even bothered to mess with manual settings.  Indoor pictures come out great without needing extra lighting.Apparently it does pretty darn well with video for the type of camera it is too, but I'm not familiar with that personally.On a side note, I really like the battery charger.  It is cordless and plugs directly into the wall as a slim rectangle that hold the battery.If you want a great camera and want to spend between $100 and $200, I would highly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Me
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm not big on cameras and my photography knowledge/skills border on zero, but my work often necessitates the taking of pictures. I received the Canon PowerShot Elph 100 as a gift a couple of years ago and found it was the best camera for someone like me. I rarely moved the dial from the "Auto" setting and found myself pleasantly surprised with the quality of the pictures I was taking. I received many positive comments about the photos I took and I was a bit embarrassed at taking the credit. Canon has produced a great little pocket sized camera here and I'm sure if I got more creative with some of the features, my photos would be even better.Sadly, the camera was stolen from the room of a B&B; I was staying at and I've missed it greatly. So, the first thing I did when I got an Amazon gift card for the holidays this year is replace it with a new one. For under $120, I would highly recommend this product to anyone who just needs a small, quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for low light and close ups.
Reviews.Author: S. Tan "ZigZag"
Reviews.Content: I hardly ever need to turn on the flash. I take a lot of pictures at night and they turn out fabulous. The hd movies take up a lot of space on the memory card. That's the only drawback I can think of at the moment. If you're looking for a easy point and shoot camera this works perfectly. There are a bunch of settings to play around with too for some fun shots.

Reviews.Title: Love IT - replacement worth the money
Reviews.Author: wendy
Reviews.Content: this was a replacement to another canon powershot that died after 6 years of use - got my monies worth from the first one so purchased this one - LOVE IT - carry it with me at all times - lots of great photos since purchase and expect many more - would buy another one - small in size and great photos for the amateur photographer...

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: Love this camera!  I had the older model so I knew what to expect.  This product does not disappoint!  Received the shipment very fast as well.

Reviews.Title: pretty good for the price
Reviews.Author: San Diego Buyer
Reviews.Content: I got this at 50 % off of list price and it is a good deal at that price point.i can't speak much for the color since i use it for IR, but it always starts up, the lens hasnt broken, and batterty life is good. this is more of a grandma camera as there are almost no manual exposure settings other than ev +/-.

Reviews.Title: Pretty happy with this little guy
Reviews.Author: SaintViper
Reviews.Content: Picked up this camera after being severely disappointed with a new Fuji camera that I bought.  All I really want is a small camera that takes decent pictures in auto mode.  I have an SLR if I want to play with settings but with a small point and shoot camera, playing with the settings just isn't worth the hassle.  It has to work well and consistently with everything set to auto.  This does what I need it to do quite well.First of all, it's small.  Really small.  Very pocket-able.  The lens fully retracts and has a built in cap which is great.  The screen is big though relatively low resolution, but good enough for framing shots and being able to tell if the picture turned out.  The 4x zoom is fine given the size of the camera and the controls are easy to work.  The flash is on the opposite side from the shutter release so I'm less likely to hold the camera with my finger in front of it.As expected, picture quality in good light is very good.  Focus speed is good when you pre-focus the camera with very little shutter lag.  If you just mash the shutter button all the way down trying to get a quick shot it's not quite so fast, but that's not really the proper way to use the camera anyway.  Flash performance is decent and I have no complaints about white balance.  Low light performance is decent.  The camera seems to ramp up the ISO intelligently based on conditions and noise reduction vs. picture quality seems well balanced.One pleasant surprise was the video quality.  I never really considered video as much more than an afterthought with point and shoot cameras, but the results from this camera are actually pretty good.  Good enough that I realized how outdated my mini-DV camcorder was after seeing far superior video quality out of this point and shoot camera and prompting a camcorder upgrade.  A newer dedicated camcorder will give better results than what this camera can, but if I'm out and about and have the urge to shoot video and don't have the camcorder, the results from this camera will do just fine.Overall, this is a nice simple camera to use and gives me pretty good results.  That's all I really expected and it's nice that this camera meets my expectations.  And I like that it's blue.

Reviews.Title: Aesthetic and performance beauty
Reviews.Author: Rohan
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera a few weeks back for my parents. A most excellent purchase. The camera's aesthetics are very pleasing, compact.. almost feels like a very smooth cellphone in your hand/pocket. Buttons are very intuitive. For the most part you can just leave it on auto and let the camera do most of the thinking..which suits the old folks just fine.Takes great pictures with and without flash. Without flash in low-light conditions is where it really shines. These pics may come out a bit softer than a regular camera, but with a lot less blur, so its a net positive by a mile. What matters is the pics in low-light no-flash conditions look a lot like how it is seen with the naked eye, so that was a huge difference over the previous point&shoots; we've had.I also have a DSLR, but can't carry that around casually. This camera has convinced me that for such instances, cellphone cameras while ok, are still far behind.The only negative in my opinion was the lack of a view-finder. I personally like to use it when I want to switch off the display screen to conserve battery life. I guess now most people don't use it anyway, or are too used to viewing through the display screen for it to bother them.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: janfran
Reviews.Content: perfect size, color, and great pictures. This camera was bought for concerts. it's easy and fun to use. A little prices though.

Reviews.Title: Easy. Does It Every Time
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "Eddie Sierra"
Reviews.Content: I have an Android phone that takes OK pictures, but I want to take great pictures of my kids and during trips. SLR cameras and even Canon's Advanced High End Digital Cameras are too bulky for me. They also have a lot of features that I never use, so I decided to buy one of Canon's ELPH cameras.My first test for the camera was a three day trip to NYC. It did great. It was small enough that I hardly noticed it in my front pocket. I took pictures all day, and I didn't need to charge the battery or download the photos to make room for more. I even took some video (video is great for kids who can't sit still long enough for a photo).I was very happy to find that Canon's software is still very easy to use. I just plugged in the camera to my computer, a program opened up to transfer the images, then ZoomBrowser opened up automatically when I closed the transfer program.I'll conclude my review here because if you need more information than this, then you probably should look into the higher end cameras. This is a very simple, but very good camera.

Reviews.Title: 4th times the charm
Reviews.Author: Sandra Mathews "mydnas"
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th Canon Powershot we have owned and so far it is my favorite. I like that they moved the manual/auto button to the top of the camera, rather than the back. And I really like that there is a totally seperate button for recording. In the past it has been in conjunction with the manual/auto button, so MANY times I would go to take a picture and it would be in record mode. Much easier to avoid that problem now. Also, the screen is larger than in the past. And I LOVE the orange color!

Reviews.Title: great entry level camera
Reviews.Author: Harry R. Moberley
Reviews.Content: was a little hesitant to purchase this camera due to the differances given by others...however, having now had the opportunity of using it, I am extremely pleased...besides being compact it has all the features a amateur photographer would want...I was really surprised at the clarity it produced in low light situations which was my biggest complaint with my Kodak...for you folks who want the best for your money this camera will "fit the bill".

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: amy smith
Reviews.Content: I primarily use my digital SLR camera; however, on occasion like the flexibility of having a small camera with me. I purchased a Nikon L20 two years ago and have been completely disappointed with it from the very start. But THIS camera is such a delight! (Maybe my expectations were low given the horrible quality of the last camera) The screen is crisp, the prints are clear, the color is bright. The battery life seems to do well. All in all, I have been very happy in the short time I've owned this camera.

Reviews.Title: Cute, functional camera!
Reviews.Author: Mac "Mac"
Reviews.Content: This camera is small, has a lot of great options to it, and is very user friendly.  Great picture quality, too!

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: JadieB
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for everyday use. Starts up super fast which is nice when you're trying to capture something on the fly.Can't figure out some settings. Menus are kind of confusing and that makes me mad because really, how hard should it be to use a digital camera?! I'm only 23 and I'd like to think I'm pretty electronic savvy, couldn't imagine my mother trying to figure this thing out. But overall pretty happy with it. Picture quality is great!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: C. Wilhite
Reviews.Content: This camera is more than I expected.  I purchased the camera on a budget and hoped that all the functions and operations would suit my needs and I found that it more than does.  I am amazed by all the different shooting functions and options and by the quality of the photos and video.  And how could you go wrong with an orange camera?!  I love it.  I suggest anyone who is looking to buy a new camera consider this one or any camera by Canon.  My previous camera was a Canon and I happily used it for about 5 years without any problems.  I would still be using it today except that someone decided they wanted it and took it without asking me first :(  Enjoy your new camera.

Reviews.Title: Works for ME!
Reviews.Author: W. L. Watts
Reviews.Content: I am a very casual photographer, wanting few bells and whistles, and a camera to be simple to operate - but still able to capture quality pictures of my grandchildren. I've only had this camera for a few days, but so far it seems to completely fit the bill. Within a few minutes of opening the box I had snapped several great pics, although inadvertently I also took several video clips of the ground too, lol. A few minutes later I had deleted the video clips and emailed the pics to my family to show off my new camera. It really doesn't get much simpler than that. I especially like the large viewing ability as it helps me take pics with a sense of confidence that 'here is the moment' cause I can make out the details so well. I have also printed the pics out on my printer and they are good, although darker than it appears on screen - but perhaps this is my printer, not the camera. I have to play around with that. I have heard others express concern about taking pics in low light with this camera, but I haven't tried that yet. Over the next month or so I will give the camera a workout as I have 2 granchildren being born within a month of each other. For now, though, I think this camera is perfect for me.

Reviews.Title: Great new camera
Reviews.Author: Huskerglenn
Reviews.Content: After having a digital camera that was usable, this new camera is ever so much more enjoyable to use!  We can take a lot more pictures without having to download them so frequently.  The pictures are much larger than on our older camera, and much easier to see.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Diana L. Stevens
Reviews.Content: Got it in plenty of time for my trip.  Easy to learn how to use it.  GREAT pictures and movies.  The size is good for putting in your pocket.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Camera
Reviews.Author: Treehouse58
Reviews.Content: This camera far exceeded my expectations. It takes great pictures, is easy to operate and it is so easy to load my pictures on my IMAC. Just plug it in and it opens in IPHOTO and there the pictures are. Great birthday gift! Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELP 100 HS - Blue
Reviews.Author: Adnan Elhallak
Reviews.Content: Very nice little camera, easy to use and takes beautiful photos.Small enough to carry at any time...and during traveling... fits easily  into your pocket.I would recommend this camera to anyone who's looking to buy a point & shoot camera at moderate price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Point and Shoot.
Reviews.Author: Scotty S. "ss_imaging"
Reviews.Content: Bought this at walmart, but its such a killer camera i have to review it!small compact and light! thats the best!great still photos, video is pretty good for such a light weight camera.i love all the picture modes/styles.main reason is the stitch assist aka panoramic mode, works like a charm! id buy another if i had too!this camera adds to my other collection of canon cameras such as my canon vixia mf30 hd camcorder.Canon, nuff said!

Reviews.Title: good camera....until it stopped working
Reviews.Author: Chuck Kandzierski
Reviews.Content: i was loving it until i got the infamous lens error about 2 months after purchase.  i hadn't used it that much.  seems to be a common problem with these things.  i am sending it to the manufacturer for repair.  we'll see how that goes....

Reviews.Title: Poor picture quality, slow shutter, limited options, surprised by rating
Reviews.Author: P-Touch User
Reviews.Content: I've owned several ELPH cameras over the years and this one is by far the worst. Terrible picture color, the entire picture gets tinted by the predominant color in the scene. Best Buy recommended this one due to the fast shutter but it is not fast, it's slow, possibly due to the auto focus, not sure. I'd say about 30 percent of the pictures I've take with this camera are blurry which is disappointing. I had the SD780 IS prior to this and that camera was great, somewhat slow focus but the picture quality was amazing. Some of the best pictures I've taken. Unfortunately it was dropped on the driveway before a snowstorm and was sucked in by the snowblower and shot against the house like a missile. I'm returning the 100HS and I'm going to try to track down the SD780 IS again.

Reviews.Title: Dreadful picture quality
Reviews.Author: Pirate "ThePirate"
Reviews.Content: There must be dozens of very positive reviews on this camera -  I cannot begin to understand this.  In just slightly low light level conditions (i.e. like anywhere indoors, which is 90% of where people use point and shoots) all images are  blurred and/or have terrible color.  I say this because any other camera at the very same occasion takes *much* better pictures.  Rich brown earth becomes gray.  Lovely faces become a blur.  Except with other cameras.When hiking in bright sunlight it set really poor exposures, either under or over exposing waterfalls.  Challenging, yes.  But our other camera did fine, had none of the same problems.We did not find the menus particularly good either.Don't buy this if you care about picture quality!

Reviews.Title: Significant improvements
Reviews.Author: James Graves "viewer"
Reviews.Content: I bought an ELPH five years ago.  It was a good camera and lasted a long time. Unfortunately it got stolen on a recent trip.  No big deal.  It was time to get a new one.The improvements in the ELPH are dramatic.  Picture quality is amazing and now you can shoot HD video (which looks great).Read the manual.  This camera is much smarter.  It has various features to improve your picture quality as well as achieve pro type shots.  It won't replace a high end SLR but it is amazing what you can do with this little camera.One of its features is that if you want to take a picture with yourself in it, it will detect when there is a new face in the shot and then take a picture. Mad!It allows you to focus on objects and then keep those objects in focus even if you move the camera to recompose the shot.It's just amazing.I love the interace. Canon has always made sense to me.Its crazy what you get for the price.  I wouldn't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: Got a Faulty camera - shutter jammed
Reviews.Author: Shalini Pothuru
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I decided to get this camera for my Dad. The camera arrived on time but when I turned it on, the lens jammed and it gave me a "Lens error. Shut down" message. I retried to no avail. Some other customers complained about the same issue. I thought it was a rare case but ended up with a faulty product myself. I was not happy because I was traveling 2 days later and this was a gift. However, I ordered Canon PowerShot ELPH 300HS immediately and received it just in time.My advice is to order this camera in advance and be prepared to return it in case you encounter a faulty piece or just go for ELPH 300HS.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Camera
Reviews.Author: amazongirl
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a replacement for the exact same one I had bought six months ago... reason for replacement.. some A**hole stole mine while I was volunteering dammit...Karma will pay them back.I love Canon Cameras.  This is my third (2nd model) and I enjoy the quality, the display and the ease of use.I have gotten quite comfortable at adjusting the settings in manual mode and am really happy when I am able to adjust the white balance or use low light settings for evening photos and have been very happy with the results.I would buy this camera again (proof being that I just did..) but really hope I don't have to!

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: sla
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera because of the image stabilization. It does not do what we expected. Many of the pictures are blurred. The color is also too vivid, almost looking 'cartoonish'. However, it takes good pics much of the time. If we can think through before we take the pic as to set the appropriate flash or setting (it has only a few settings) then we can avoid the blur and the weird color problem. But when taking pics of kids or pets its a bit hard to switch modes and flash settings quickly enough. I would not recommend this camera for anyone with children. Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Better than Nikon. (esp the s3100 model)
Reviews.Author: Toni
Reviews.Content: I had the Nikon s3100 and I lost it...., and you know what ? I'm GLAD I did. I just got this from Best Buy and there is NO WAY you can compare it to the Nikon camera. The low light settings is incredible, and it also takes very clear shots. I say for people who are contemplating to get it, GET IT NOW ! Its on sale and I'm pretty sure it ends today. Regular price its 179.99 but its worth it ! I got it in pink, the color is BEAUTIFUL ! <3333333333SN:I saw some reviews that says you cant zoom in video, well that's NOT true. That I was the first thing I tried out when I first got it on. Probably people didn't know how to do it or right or idk. It worked for me though.

Reviews.Title: Lens retract problem
Reviews.Author: North Star
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera about 2wks. and already the lens won't retract. I was happy with the different settings and loved the results but can't deal with a camera that is unreliable so i am exploring a Lumix Panasonic..

Reviews.Title: good for everyone's pocket
Reviews.Author: Sherry Ford
Reviews.Content: I bought for my father as a gift. He likes it so much that he put it in his pocket all the time. He use it took HD videos of my daughter most the time. Everyday he shows me new videos. The quality of the HD videos is much better than I thought.  He took pictures, too. When playback on our 46'' TV, the videos are sharp and the pictures are very good.Good for indoor and outdoor use.Pros: good quality of HD videos, light weight and small size, easy to use, good performance under low-light condition.Cons: sometimes the focus is not good when taking videos(3 or 4 times so far, in about 50 days), battery life (I bought 3 more batteries for my father, so this won't be a problem for me).After I bought this, i never use our camcorder anymore.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWER SHOT ELPH 100 HS 12MP
Reviews.Author: RAD "RAD"
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! USED MY CANNON THIS WEEKEND AND THE PICTURES WERE "AWESOME."  I'VE TWO(2) CANONS, POWER SHOT G11 AND A GREAT "RELIABLE" Z155 FILM CAMERA. I WANTED A SMALLER DIGITAL POCKET CAMERA, WHERE THE FLASH WAS A "BANG." THE EASE OF USAGE FOR THE ELPH IS VERY EASY,  SOMEWHAT SIMILAR TO MY OTHER TWO. I'VE YET TO USE THE MOVIE MODE, ON ON THIS "COMPACT BABY." I'M NOT GOING TO PUT TO MUCH EMPHASIS ON THE MOVIE MODE; SINCE I'VE THE POWER SHOT G11, WHICH TAKES GOOD MOVIES. YOU CAN'T GO WRONG WITH THE CANON POWERSHOT ELPH 100 AND CAN'T BE MISSED WITH THE BLUE.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: J. Bitzer "PurrfectPrincess"
Reviews.Content: Ive only had my camera a week. And i just love it, My favorite scene modes are Fisheye, Poster Effect and Super Vivid. Its slim and light weight Ive been carrying it around in my wallet. I also really love the Pink color The stock shot does not do justice to just how beautiful the pink is. When i was looking for a camera I was looking for Something with fun features that also took really great shots And took them rather quickly Chasing after two kiddos (7 and 3) I need a quick camera. So far this has meet my needs for a camera very well.

Reviews.Title: NOT
Reviews.Author: Leah "amazonregular"
Reviews.Content: I repeat, not sturdy.  great features that wont work if you don'coddle this camera. My olde 3 mp is still going

Reviews.Title: I take over 1,000 pictures a day!
Reviews.Author: Mike Speirs
Reviews.Content: Great camera! I'm a home inspector and I use it everyday for work!  It has all the features I need.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for all ages!
Reviews.Author: Grandma "from  Jersey"
Reviews.Content: This is the easiest camera to work and takes great photo's.  I would recommend this camera to everyone of any age!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: KTB "KTB"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great photos, particularly in good light. Its compact size makes it easy to carry. The non-auto functions are a bit difficult to access in the menu.

Reviews.Title: Taking photo around
Reviews.Author: carl
Reviews.Content: Many seniors in my country don't have the chance to record their daily life. So, it's present for dad and mom to share their joys with more people around them.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This was my first purchase of a point-and-shoot camera.  I have 3 young boys (all under 8) and I needed something to take with me that would take quality pictures.  This camera lasted me almost 2 years and it's still going.  I've dropped it numerous times and managed to get a crack across the screen, however it was still viewable and only seemed to have cracked the glass.  I used it for 8 or 9 months that way before accidently letting it get a little wet.  Once it got wet, the flash stopped working, but other then that, IT STILL WORKS!  I used this camera to take professional quality pictures of my kids and even had some blown up to poster size without them getting grainy.  I also used this to video tape everything of my children.  I love this camera and would recommend it to ANYONE!  Also, it has the Accent Color feature, which is awesome!

Reviews.Title: So nice I bought it twice
Reviews.Author: adad4tms
Reviews.Content: I had already owned this model Canon camera and it was my favorite traveling picture taker.Unfortunately, on a recent motorcycle ride it was left sitting on top of a saddlebag and not in a pocket and it met an untimely demise due to road rash...I liked this little camera enough to buy another.Only complaint is that it falls apart... when it skips down the road... at 60mph

Reviews.Title: Small and so easy to use.
Reviews.Author: maccabbee
Reviews.Content: Love Canon products. So simple and easy to use. Bought one several years ago, and got another for my husband.

Reviews.Title: Great, dependable camera!
Reviews.Author: Cathy C.
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, great resolution. Have recommended to several friends who have purchased the same or upgrades, with same  satisfied results.

Reviews.Title: compact, easy to use, auto mode is excellent
Reviews.Author: Arrrg! "Living like a millionaire on the budg...
Reviews.Content: I really love how intuitive this camera is to use.I was shooting great pictures right out of the box and the small size allows me to always have it in my pocket while traveling.I love the wide angle lens and the zoom is adequate for most shots. But I don't expect to get a big zoom on a camera this small though.Battery life is better than expected, and the video is excellent.The only downside I have found id the microphone for the video makes the wind sound louder than it really is, but this is a minor complaint for a camera that is this small and takes photos that are actually frame-able.I also bought the Canon WP-DC320L Waterproof Underwater Housing Case for PowerShot Elph 300 HS Camera to go with this and have used this camera snorkeling over a dozen times.I'd buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: Lori Hart
Reviews.Content: Our staff takes a lot of photos on a daily basis and we also required a day and time staff.  We have been using Canon PowerShots for a few years now and they are well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: like the colors
Reviews.Author: D. Gregory
Reviews.Content: Good little camera. We bought two, one for work and one for vacations. The Canon battery holds a charge well. The knock off rechargeable does not hold a charge for very long.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot 100 HS 12.1
Reviews.Author: J. A. Scull "artist"
Reviews.Content: Have had this camera for three years. It is the best little camera I have ever owned. Took to Italy and shot 400 pictures there. Take photos almost daily and am never disappointed. It's important to read and learn how this camera works in the booklet. Highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Practically all you could ask you for unless you really have need of a super-telescopic lens
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: Canon Elphs still produce measureable, noticeably superior results to the smartphone cameras, both still photos and videos.  The settings are more numerous and precise (unless you, like most users, choose to leave the camera on permanent auto mode); image stabilization is better (even though its far more crucial on the phone cameras), the lens and, now, the stereo mics provide images that can compete with the best any 1080p flat-screen TV is capable of.  On top of those features, this entry-level Canon has burst mode, permitting me to get the right picture at the right moment of my pets (2 cats, maybe a piglet one of these days) and grand-kids.  Unless you've caught the super-telephoto lens bug that camera manufacturers are using as a primary ploy to lure more customers to the dedicated point-and-shoots, the Elph 100 should satisfy on practically all counts.I still hang on to my SD-780 because it was the last Elph to have a viewfinder (which I still count on during the high-sun times of the day) and because of the great shots and videos it's given me in the past as well as my discovering that a 3X power lens actually serves me better than a 10X, 15X, or 20X power lens (please don't afflict your friends with endless "zoom shots" merely call attention to the gadgetry of the camera and detract from your subject--besides making some of us feel the effects of vertigo and sea-sickness).  Most of us will get far better photos and videos if we stop messing with the zoom gadgetry and use are bodies to move the camera closer to the subject.
