Reviews.Content: I asked for a pink camera for christmas, I told people I wanted a Canon, but I forgot to tell of the one I had chosen. I chose this for myself and it is what I recieved. It has a HUGE SCREEN and great quality.Update: Thanksgiving 2013We went to the mountains for Thanksgiving, and I OCD about my camera and all tech. It was around 17 degrees at one point and now the screen is all messed up. I have never dropped it, gotten it wet, or anything of the kind so my family and I have come to the conclusion it may have been overexposure to such a low temperature.

Reviews.Title: Can PowerShot ELPH 100
Reviews.Author: Happy Homemaker
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera. I love taking pictures but I am certainly not a photographer, so far it has been easy to use and I love the way it automatically adjusts to the light. It is still new and I am continuing to learn more about my camera. On the cosmetic side I love the blue camera that I bought and was pleased they offered it in a choice of colors.They only down side for me is the control wheel is small, I suppose to make space for the larger screen but then I knew that when I purchased it and felt that for me I wanted the larger screen. I like its small size for portability.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 100 Review
Reviews.Author: Dave K.
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom (Blue) along with Case Logic TCB-302 compact camera case and Transcend 8GB HDSC memory card. I am most pleased with all three items. The Canon ELPH in particular is an upgrade form our previos Nikon Sureshot digital camera in every way. Thaks again Amazon for great poducts at reasonable prices with swift shipping!

Reviews.Title: Canon Elph 100
Reviews.Author: John Lee
Reviews.Content: This was bought as an early Christmas gift for my son and family. They love the cameras ease of use and the great pictures it takes.  Great price and quick shipping at Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Med 1
Reviews.Content: small, great pictures, good reliability, and nice size screen.  Not sure you could ask for any more in a camera.

Reviews.Title: wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: M. Ferrari "grammie"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my granddaughter and now have to get myself a new one... love this camera the zoom is great the pictures come out excellent... love the pink color too.. and easy enough for the 9 y/o to handle it

Reviews.Title: What a great camera
Reviews.Author: A. Aldridge
Reviews.Content: I love my new camera. Easy to hold and carry around in my pocket, has wonderful options for shooting and it is very easy to operate.  I will enjoy this for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: cannon 12 megapixel camara
Reviews.Author: sugarbear
Reviews.Content: For a small camara a lady can cary in her purse or a guy on his belt this little camara takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Nita
Reviews.Content: It's compact, easy to use and fits easily in my purse. Photos are amazing and colors are true even in low light.  I'm looking forward to taking lots of photos during the holidays.  I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot delivers!
Reviews.Author: Vickie D
Reviews.Content: The Canon PowerShot Elph 100 is a great camera with a lot of awesome features. It has a big screen, it is easy to use, the picture quality is really good, it is slim and easily fits in your pocket.  It is very reasonably priced and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: frequent shopper
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for the birth of our baby girl...we have used it in camera photo mode and shot videos.  I am very impressed with sound quality and picture quality...we have taken about 200 photos and 15 videos.  It was well worth what we paid for it. The photos we had printed are excellent quality.  The camera is very easy to use as well.  I highly recommend this product!!

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: A. White
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter's birthday & she loves it! It's about the size of a cell phone & very easy to use & carry in her purse. She loves that it takes great pics in low light areas. I got the carry case & the 8g memory card for her too & she's very happy with it all.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and video but poor build quality
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best compact cameras I owned. The pictures taken in low light look awesome. I like the large 3 inch LCD display. The resolution of the LCD display is 230,000 pixels, which is great. The camera fits inside my shirt pocket and I don't need a case to carry with.That said, the camera is built with cheap material.

Reviews.Title: Incredible camera!
Reviews.Author: Edwin I. Plimpton
Reviews.Content: "This is a must-have camera.  For a point & shoot, it brags more shooting settings than I've seen on this small a camera.  I esp like the "best shot" setting and the "low light" settings.  But - the most important is the ability to shoot in low light without flash and still give a clear image without much digital noise. This is the best of the "Elf" series cameras I have used yet, and the 12 MP image it produces just adds to it's capabilities.  You can't go wrong with this little 'carry everywhere' image maker.  A++

Reviews.Title: Best Little Camera yet....
Reviews.Author: Grandma Annie
Reviews.Content: Used this camera on European vacation.  Great shots, auto focus, no time wasted.  Best purchase I have made in a long time.  Beat HSN for similar camera.  This one is much easier to use and great for arthritic hands.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: Had this camera for a few months now and have had 0 problems with it. Very, very nice camera. The zoom is a bit small, but that's it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera for a teen!!!
Reviews.Author: Starbuck58
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera for my Granddaughter's 13th birthday when I found this one. This one is very fast in responding to the shutter button, (which is a problem for most point & shoots) and takes great photos in all lighting conditions. The camera makes all the adjustments for you, so the photos come out great even if you don't know the right settings. Perfect for a teen who just wants to point & shoot. Also takes great video (Another big plus). She loves the color too (pink). At this price, i think Canon hit this one out of the park. Way to go Canon!!!

Reviews.Title: Worth the Price
Reviews.Author: Lou
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera alot! Its so much better than the Samsung I had purchased for the same price about a year ago!

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot ELPH 100
Reviews.Author: Kindle jacket
Reviews.Content: Great little camera. It takes the same battery and cards as my previous one so worked out great. Easy to use and small enough not to be bulky carrying.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: muskey-john
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a quality "point and shoot" camera at reasonable price and the Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 fits that slot perfectly.  Extremely easy to use and a very convient size.  We have been extremely pleased with the quality of the photos, including indoor shots which come out extremely well.  This camera is exactly what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: Liking it so far
Reviews.Author: Steve Lankford
Reviews.Content: I grabbed on of these a few days ago after my old Powershot A570 IS decided that it would not accept batteries any longer.  I had that camera for 4 years, so it was time for a change.  The first thing that struck me about this camera was how small it is.  Almost too small.  The screen is great (bigger than my old camera), but the buttons are miniscule!  I got over that pretty quick, however, once I realized I could just pop this thing in my pocket and forget about it until I needed it.  So far I've had some moderate success in taking pictures.  I've noticed that there's a bit of noise unless I am completely still, but I'm still learning the camera.  Burst mode is pretty cool, but the pics are fairly low-res.  However I really like the continous mode, which is like Burst mode but takes a few less pics.If you are like me, and just want to have a low cost, handy point and shoot to take pics of the kids, I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: lived up to expectations
Reviews.Author: Brad Kohen
Reviews.Content: I heard a lot of good things about this camera for this price range and for point and shoot cameras in general.  I have to say that it has exceeded those expectations.  First one of the most impressive features is the removable, rechargeble battery cartridge that has extremely long life.  I went to a wedding in Chicago and after 5 days probably about 150 pictures and a couple of 1 to 2 minute videos the battery was still full charged.  The second impressive quality is the video feature.  the videos it takes are extremely clear (possibly more clear than the pictures).  It would be nice to have more control of taking manual pictures but for the most part this camera works so well on auto that it wasn't much of an issue.  The only problem I had was trying to take pictures at night but that may have had more to do with my inexperience taking pictures than the camera itself since I was trying to take night shots of the lights on buildings far away using 4X zoom.  Overall I was very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon digital Elph 100HS100
Reviews.Author: Barbara O. "Barbara"
Reviews.Content: So far, I'm very pleased with the camera at the price I paid.  I know there are better cameras for a little more money, but my goal was not to spend above $175.  I carry it around in my backpack and snap things that interest me, and that's where small and slim comes in handy...

Reviews.Title: Excellent as expected from Canon cameras
Reviews.Author: PT58 "PT58"
Reviews.Content: I bought this Canon ELPH 100 to replace my old Canon PowerShot SD750 which had a cracked lenses due to heavy use and one too many drops.  The ELPH takes excellent photos, is easy to understand, and uses the same SD card and NB-4L battery as the SD750.  I popped the old battery and SD card out of my old camera and into the new and kept shooting photos without missing a beat, while the new battery was charging and the new SD card is waiting in reserve.With all the specialization, it's a compliment to Canon that they kept their new camera interchangeable with the old.  Connection cords, battery, battery charger, SD card, and controls...all work.  There was a 5 minute learning curve, enough time to simply navigate through the menu to confirm everything was understandable.  This is my 4th Canon Powershot and I am very pleased with Canon.  These cameras are always with me.The size fits into my jeans or shirt pocket, and the feel of the camera is very good for my regular-sized hands.  Love it!  Thanks Canon, kudos for making a great product at a very good price.

Reviews.Title: A great point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: slarus
Reviews.Content: I must admit I originally bought this camera because of the positive reviews for it already posted on Amazon.com and it lived up to it's praise quite well.  I bought it to take to Europe and left it on auto setting all of the time.  I got very good pictures in low light situations and the stained glass windows in the cathedrals which are often hard to photograph turned out amazingly well with this camera. For convenience, ease of use, quality and size, this slim point and shoot camera does a good job.

Reviews.Title: No bad photo pictures
Reviews.Author: Steve the utility man
Reviews.Content: This is one of most amazing smart digital camera.PLUSES: Every picture we took during the trip looks great and everything looks better. Great for HD Video Camera, make sure you have 16GB+ SD for video recording in 720P or 1080P.NEGATIVE: All the food dishes looks great even though it's really ordinary, can be a positive for some ;)

Reviews.Title: cute
Reviews.Author: michael baror
Reviews.Content: when i got this camera i was surprised it was a beautiful blue not like the picture a bit darker i loved this i bough it for my girlfriend and her face was priceless worth every penny

Reviews.Title: easy operating camera
Reviews.Author: Eugene J. Stanchina
Reviews.Content: this camera is excellent for me i am a senior and if i can operate it anyone can very good instructions and takes excellent pictures for my purposes. would highly recommend this camera also was shipped to me very quickly by amazon.

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Rafael "Movie Guy"
Reviews.Content: I was looking at all the different point and shoots from all different types of companies. When I came across this Canon Camera I fell in love with the camera.I upgraded from a "Canon PowerSHot SD1000 Digital Elph." When I bought my camera I didn't have to buy an extra battery cause my old one works in the knew one.I would recommend buying a card which is a SDHC card so you will be able to take HD video for a lot longer then a few seconds.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: AtieK08
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly fast camera that shoots high quality photos.  It also has a good video option.  There is a bit of a delay when taking pictures, but it hasn't had any impact on my shots so far.  I'm pleased with the purchase and would get this camera again.

Reviews.Title: Very nice value!
Reviews.Author: mTecNic "Nic"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my lady's birthday. She really does like it after the 10 minutes of menu fussing. Some of the controls are not intuitive at first but after you've realized where they are it becomes second nature to using them. She's already taken a bunch of pictures and really likes the quality. It does pretty well in low light and does extremely good in well lit places.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: trendsetter
Reviews.Content: Been using the camera for the past several weeks.  Light weight, small - very convenient for family use.  I highly recommend this for any day shoots!

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Sunny Boutique Chris
Reviews.Content: Great camera...extremely compact.  Couldn't be easier to use!  This can be used by kids and adults without any frustration or learning curve.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: After an experimental period with a Samsung digital camera, we have happily returned to the world of quick snap shots, good pic quality, and fun effects with our cannon.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer "Jennifer Anne"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small point and shoot that would take good pictures.. This is EXACTLY what I was looking for! Very happy!

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: Olivia
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera.. It is perfect for anything and takes good action shots.. It is such a cute color 2!! ALL IN ALL.. BEST CAMERA I HAVE HAD YET!!

Reviews.Title: Scoring Shots!
Reviews.Author: bwilkew
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome gift for my friend. It's not easy at first to figure out but once you get the hang of it, it has a lot of options to choose from. It's more or less a fun camera and for some clear shots. It's takes fast pictures to and the color quality is good too. It has a large enough screen to view images. The only problem I just had though was it had a lens error and the lens got stuck and it hasnt been dropped or bumped. Everything else was fine though, it has many creative features if youre looking for fun shooting!!

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: J. McRae
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife's birthday and she loves it. Much better than the Nikon sheHad before. The only complaint is you can't control the flash other than off or auto

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!!
Reviews.Author: Momof2
Reviews.Content: This was my first time buying a Canon rather than a Kodak. I love how clear the picture is and how my images look. I have two kids so most of my pictures are of them and they always turn out great. I haven't used the video yet so I cant comment on that. I also love the color it is very cute.

Reviews.Title: Video Deficiencies
Reviews.Author: Dennis
Reviews.Content: Still photos seem good, but all I've beena ble to download from videos is .mov files.  I can't figure out how to configure the camera to take .avi files.  I know I can convert .mov to .avi, but I believe every conversion costs in quality.  I have a library of .avi files I use for video editing.  The .mov video clips from the Canon 100 HS do not work with my .avi library without conversion.  All my previous digital cameras have been Canons and have taken .avi video clips.  Had I known of the new Canon standard or Canon ELPH 100 HS limitation of only taking .mov video clips, I would not have bought it.  OK for still snapshots.  Not usable for me for video clips.  I'll buy another camera and give or throw this one away.  My next digital camera will not be a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Why does Canon keep getting worse and worse?
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Edwards "Robert"
Reviews.Content: It was practically impossible to take an out-of-focus shot with the 970.  With the 1400, it was almost impossible to take a focused shot in macro mode.  The autofocus was accurate when you pushed halfway down on the button, but once you pushed down further to take the actual pic, it as as often as not lost focus.Now theres the ELFH 100HS, which has the opposite problem.  It's fine in macro mode, but for any other type of shots, the autofocus doesn't work.  I've heard complaints from friends about the same problem with the SX 110 IS.Canon's P&S; cameras used to be great.  Now they're among the worst.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for ... junk
Reviews.Author: P. Maizitis "Big Spender"
Reviews.Content: 1. Slow or incorrect auto-focus in both video and photo mode. Multiple botched shots and wasted footage. Example - slow pan of crowd at the Rock and Roll Hall of fame induction .... footage was completely out of focus. Next pan shot was fine.2. Excessive shutter roll. Example - took video of our puppies inside the house ... excessive shutter roll even on slow pans. The next day it was not showing this rolling shutter effect as much.3. Just for information - it only takes 10 minute video clips at a time so if you are thinking of strapping one of these on for a lengthy ski or skateboard run ... forget about it.Bought on special from Walmart with bundled 2 GB SD card for $89.99.A defective unit or typical performance? I won't waste money another one of these. Would not recommend to a friend.Summary: one miserable little camera.PS: I've take photos for corporations and shows and weddings with both budget and professional grade cameras with great results ... however avoid this Made in China product.

Reviews.Title: OMG I LOVE THIS CAM!
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: FIRST OF ALL I LOOOOOVE THE COLOR OF THE CAM AND IT JUST TAKES UH-MAZING PICTURES!!!I GET A LOT OF COMPLIMENTS WHEN PEOPLE SEE THE COLOR AND THE CLARITY OF THE PICS IT TAKES ITS JUST AWESOME.IVE ALWAYS BOUGHT CANON CAMS BECAUSE THEYRE COOL LOOKING AND THEY LAST VERY LONG!

Reviews.Title: Canon ELPH 100
Reviews.Author: Bruce Lee "Let-it-be"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter. The name will tell it all. Light weight, easy to use and very clear pictures. The only regret I have that this camera would just use regular AA batteries like Duracell or any regular Alkaline batteries. The bottom line is a heck of a camera. Again, so happy I got it from amazon.com. keep up the good work amazon.com. Amazon is the best. Thanks

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little camera
Reviews.Author: Susan Snodgrass "Book Lover"
Reviews.Content: I needed a good digital camera and I asked my cousin's husband, who is a photographer, to recommend one.  He told me he'd always been a Canon man.  Now, I can't begin to afford, nor desire to tackle, the kind of equipement he has, but this camera is superb!  It has tons of different aspects to it, too much to do that I'll never use it for, but it takes super pics and they look great all the time!

Reviews.Title: Good video and quality with simple control, but doesn't always focus right
Reviews.Author: Janelle
Reviews.Content: The camera takes nice pictures IF you hold it very still.  I don't ever have problems with our Nikon coolpix or Canon SLR XS but about 1 in 6 are blurry on this camera.  We bought it for the high rating of video quality and that is true it takes good video if it is focused before you start recording.  It has a simple easy to use menu with just the essential button like flash and timer available at your fingertips, you have to dig for the others.  We like this because what we use and only what we use is right there and easy to find. It has seperate buttons to start video or tke a picture which eliminates when you go to take a picture and realize you started a video and missed the picture.  Overall I really like the camera,especially for video, just wish it was better at stabilizing or would focus easier.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kathryn
Reviews.Content: This is a great point and shoot camera. Very crisp images and very compact. Large screen is a plus if you like to share the pictures. I have to keep resetting the date and time for some reason. All my date, time, time zone settings are correct? I would definitely recommend this camera otherwise. Amazon.com had a great bundle deal with camera, sd card and camera case.

Reviews.Title: The little camera that could
Reviews.Author: Martin K.
Reviews.Content: Speed factor: This Canon Elph 100 HS is truly the best all-around camera!  When you must be quick to draw the camera, it's ready to shoot, including the dedicated video button.  You only need your pants pocket to draw, not the case which may take longer. Press the On-Off button and it's ready to shoot faster than most cameras!Low-light factor: many situations are low-light and require flashes.  Not so with this little camera. In some situations, flashes are not allowed.  Besides, if you take flash pix, you may get the unwanted red-eye shots. Even with dim situations, the shots won't be grainy!Video factor: the best video mode ever!User-friendly factor: the screen is 3" which is just right for everyone to see the scenes.  The menu is responsive and user-friendly.  Easy and quick to learn.  Also, most people prefer to take automatic shots.  This camera is dedicated to do just that.  Just point and shoot; the camera does most of the work for you.Battery factor:  excellent battery life.  Best yet, you can get an extra battery and charge it up easily with a charger that plugs directly.Conclusion: get your butt off the chair and buy that Canon Elph 100 HS!

Reviews.Title: A. Filippone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So far, the camera is performing as I expected.  The  numerous options that can be programmed in the manual mode give me the flexibility to use it as an SLR camera.  I wish the battery lasted longer than it does.  The wide angle lens makes it easy to take close indoor shots of a large group of people.  I would have liked a working optical zoom in the recording mode.  In summary, this camera is worth the money. And, as usual, Amazon had the lowest price.

Reviews.Title: So many features! The worst part of this camera is the wrist strap.
Reviews.Author: Amy Koller
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing! They have packed so much into this tiny package. My last Canon PS1200 was stolen at Disneyland, otherwise I would've never bought a new one - that was a great camera! But now that I have this one I'm realizing how far Canon has come in just a few short years! My one and only complaint is the terrible wrist strap! But that's an easy fix.

Reviews.Title: No USB charging, and battery goes dead if you leave it connected to your computer
Reviews.Author: T. Cook
Reviews.Content: Lack of a critical feature/software kills this thing. The camera is fine for what it is, and would normally get 4 or 5 starts, but a camera that constantly has a dead battery is pretty useless. No USB charging, and the camera kills its better if you leave it connected to your computer. These two issues kill the product for me. A dead camera is about as useful as no camera. Come on Canon, get with the program, and have built in USB charging, or at least have the camera power off after 10min of inactivity if connected to computer.

Reviews.Title: grate
Reviews.Author: Adina Moshavi
Reviews.Content: its a amazeng camra that has tunes of opthins it has rely good qualty and is rely easy to yose

Reviews.Title: Great low light camera
Reviews.Author: John Stodola
Reviews.Content: I've been a Fuji fan since 2004 when I bought an F-20.  I dislike using a flash and that camera was great in low light.  It's on its last legs so I did some research and picked this Canon.Wow - this camera is fabulous in low light.  Just what I wanted.Pros:- fabulous in low light (I use it on Auto - you can set the Program to low light, but it reduces the image size)- very good user manual so I can figure out how to use its features- nice compact size, easy to carry- nice display, with detailed info after shots- a burst shot mode so you can capture moving objects- controls for shutter speed and ISO- excellent batter lifeCons:- slippery surface (but this is true of most cameras - hey, put some rubber  on it so we can grip it)- the FuncSet and MENU menus are somewhat difficult to figure outMore:- do yourself a favor, download the user guide and spend an hour trying the various options- got this in a package deal with case and 4GB card from Costco for less than the camera at Amazon.

Reviews.Title: mbatranch
Reviews.Author: Randolf J. Rice
Reviews.Content: This was my third ELPH; not because the two earlier ones were less than perfect.  Instead, two friends liked them so much that I gave them to them after being praised about the cameras!  This one is even better than the earlier models.  It seems slightly more compact with wonderful features (like 4x Optical Zoom).  Even with the camera case (an additional purchase) it's easy to carry, fits easily into a pocket, and is ready to use quickly.  I give it a five star rating!

Reviews.Title: best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Olivia
Reviews.Content: this is the 2nd digi cam I ever own and I think its the best thing since sliced bread!!!! take amazing pictures inside or out. The rechargeable battery pack is my favorite part!!! and it lasts FOREVER!!! I've used other cameras that you can take maybe 20 pictures and the batteries die, not this one, I can used it for multiple occasions and not have to charge it for months! I had issues getting it, and it took over a month to get it, but it was bc the label had gotten cut off, my address is 312, and it got cut off and looked like 112, but once I contacted the seller, I went to the post office and it was there (: This was the absolute best $130 I ever spent, and I would do it again!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot Elph 100 HS 12.1 MP
Reviews.Author: Leah Swinney
Reviews.Content: i purchased this camera for my daughter and she loves it!!!  I am very happy with it!  Love the color as well!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: SCOTT EBERHART
Reviews.Content: I master this camera in minutes after I got it. It work great. Even was here fast!  I own two of them now. It excellent taken pictures I love them.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing quality
Reviews.Author: Geep
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my dead Canon A610.  That one was a 5 MPX and I was more than satisfied with the quality of the pictures.  I was unpleasantly surprised with the quality of the shots on this new 12 MPX camera.  They are not nearly as crisp or clear, regardless of the settings.  Disappointed with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: still good
Reviews.Author: mm
Reviews.Content: What can I say, this is my second purchase. Thought of going for the it's higher end sibling, but alas, still waiting for my dollar notes to dry.

Reviews.Title: Very worthy
Reviews.Author: Hailey Hoang
Reviews.Content: It looks elegant and has a large screen. Seems to be one of the best choices among cameras in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: duh--camera review
Reviews.Author: Steph S. "SS"
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera, but I won't give it five stars because, just like the other Canon we had, it leans to too-dark pics at times. According to the reviews I had read, it didn't do that. And I'm sure we don't "take" pics any differently than other inexpensive-Canon owners.

Reviews.Title: Takes really great pictures,
Reviews.Author: Duane Balay
Reviews.Content: Takes really great pictures, Fair zoom, Fits in shirt pocket, and is light weight. Lots of features for a camera this size. Great buy

Reviews.Title: good to purchase
Reviews.Author: madhu
Reviews.Content: it is giving a good clarity pictures,with this price range it wud be the best option to purchase,I strongly recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Manuel J. Delacruz
Reviews.Content: This is the second time i buy this camera for my Gf because i broke the first one. great Cam and shoots HD very well

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS 12.1
Reviews.Author: Latchman
Reviews.Content: I have limited knowledge about cameras, so this was the recommendation from my sons Videsh and Navin. I am totally pleased with the crispness of the quality of the shots......great great buy!

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It isn't a DSLR but it will get the job done for my backpacking trips.  Wish Cannon would incorporate a "share it now" feature.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!!
Reviews.Author: tim
Reviews.Content: this is a awesome camera!! has all the features I want, takes great photos and video is great!! very easy to use! the negatives about this camera is that the buttons are too small. the video for this version( canon powershot 100 HS) has only digital zoom for the video, while the canon powershot 300 HS has optical zoom for video taking. if that is not a problem and you want to save $30-40 dollars then this is the camera for you. I noticed people reviewing this camera don't even understand the difference...canon is well known for designing great cameras, you can't go wrong with the canon powershot 100 HS

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: TheRohrers
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for our son who was going to Holland after graduation.  He loved it.  Easy to use, took good pictures, small enough to fit in his pocket and he loved the orange color as it is the official color of The Netherlands.  Thinking of getting another one for our daughter who is moving to Japan for 1 1/2 years.  As for the quality of pictures, I think they were very good, but hard to judge as his heart wasn't always into taking that perfect picture.  He just wanted to document his trip.  Its a perfect camera for travel and for fun.  We may borrow it for an extra camera to take on our Europe trip.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: J. holcomb
Reviews.Content: For the price this is a great camera.  HD video.  This isn't a DSLR.  It is a P&S.;  It does it well.  My wife loves it.

Reviews.Title: Great small camera
Reviews.Author: C. Locke
Reviews.Content: Takes really great pictures, Fair zoom, but what can you expect for a small compact camera. Fits in shirt pocket, and is light weight. Lots of features for a camera this size. A very good value.

Reviews.Title: Not a camera for the beach...:-(
Reviews.Author: AnnM
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it takes wonderful pictures, video is amazing and pretty much anyone can point, shoot and come out with a perfect image.This is my second Canon elph and unfortunatley...they both broke the same way---sand.Even a few peices of sand can destroy your camera. The first time I was taking a picture of the lake when a huge gust of wind blew sand on me and the camera.  That was the last picture I took.  This last time, I went to the beach with my son (he's 1 and it was his first trip.  After pitting the camera on the blanket in order to go run after him...that was the last of that camera.Moral of the story. Buy this camera...don't take it to the beach, or near sand.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: Theresa
Reviews.Content: This little camera is not a true point and shoot device.  You have to let the camera choose the shot which may take a moment.  Not good for landscape images-photos are grainy. Very slippery in the hand.  Does not handle moving subjects, and has difficulty focusing on more than one subject. May focus on the wrong subject and ruin the shot.  Zoom capabilities are not impressive.The only thing I like about this camera is the video capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Not really impressed.
Reviews.Author: Guy in Florida
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera from a local Staples store, and then a couple of days later I took it back to that store for a refund. I already knew that the ELPH100 disabled the zoom when in movie mode; that was no problem since I'm not a fan of zooming in and out while the video is rolling. What I didn't know was that the autofocus is also crippled. Now, what good is a point and shoot camera that doesn't maintain focus?The whole point of a point and shoot is that you can point it at something and get a decent picture--or video--without having to waste time fumbling around with settings while the action around you passes by. After all, life waits for no one. Especially children or grandchildren.If it was just the movie-autofocus problem, I would have been tempted to keep the darn thing, and I was close to doing just that. But no...I had to go ahead and test the pointy-eared, little ELPH's picture quality against my old, 5MP, brick-like, troll-of-a-Sony. (Seriously! With its fat, weighty little, metal body; you could really hurt someone with that ancient thing if you whipped it around by its wrist strap.)The picture quality of the Canon ELPH isn't really that bad, but when you consider that it has a technological leap of seven or eight years over the clunky Sony, it's far less than impressive. The outdoor shots looked harsh and the highlights more than a little blown out. And the colors? Well, our green garbage can looked yellower than I ever imagined it. Sure, the sun was bright on that day here in Florida, but my old Sony Cybershot didn't seem to have a problem with it. Colors with the Sony looked much more natural and as true as one of these cheap little cameras can get.Some might say that it's not fair to judge the Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 solely on its preset, automatic features. To that, I say again; isn't that the point of a point and shoot?

Reviews.Title: get this camera!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: No other camera can come close to this one! Fun little camera! Good for beginers and experts!!!!! I would for sure choose no other camera then this one!!!!!!!!!!!! I love canon!

Reviews.Title: Budget Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: SAN_MARINO
Reviews.Content: This digital camera is good for daily use and if you don't care about the picture quality.  Plus, it is very user-friendly and nothing really technical involved.  One con side is "Made in China" so I don't expect this camera will survive more than 2 years life span.

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: I don't know much about cameras, nor do I care.  All I wanted was a small, easy to use camera that takes clear pictures.  I found it with this one!  It is super easy to use, with prompts on the menu to help you figure out what to do.  It is super easy to down load, charge the battery, ect.  The picture quality is perfect for my needs and I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Love Canon, but camera is NOT durable at all
Reviews.Author: C. Wang
Reviews.Content: I loooove Canon PowerShots, I've owned roughly 6 of them in the past 6 years (Yes, SIX) and every time one breaks, I go and purchase the next and newest PowerShot model because I love them so much.  I find the interface so easy to use as a non-technical user, and the camera has always been one of most compact ones on the market so I just keep it in my purse 24/7 (because let's face it, most photo-worthy moments are not the ones you plan for..  The battery is awesome and holds a charge forever.  This newest model does not disappoint - although I have to admit that I never really see a huge difference in functionality/performance between each successive model, other than the greater megapixel capability.It is with a heavy heart, however, that I have decided to move on from my beloved Canon cameras.  The one huge issue I have found (and trust me, the fact that i've had 6 of these in the past 6 years should prove this) is that they are have no longevity - they are NOT hearty, easily breakable and delicate.  Between my numerous cameras, I've found the durability to be one of the poorest attributes of these cameras.  I can't always fault the manufacturer as some of my broken cameras were inevitably my fault, but there were some major problems that went wrong with some of these that should not have happened.  Here is a brief list of how my 6 cameras met their demise:1. Canon PowerShot SD200 - Had 2 years - Dropped off a stool. Yes, 100% my fault, but the stool was like 2 feet off the ground and the camera was totally dead afterwards!  So I'll say 90% my fault.2. Canon PowerShot SD300 - Had 10 months - When camera would turn on, lens got stuck and wouldn't come out. Perhaps dust or something got into it, but the lens refused to expand and contract and camera permanently and made a grinding noise instead.  Replacement lens was so expensive that camera repairman just recommended I buy a new camera.3. Canon PowerShot SD1000 - Had 5 months - LCD screen stopped working.  Camera could take pictures but wouldn't show up on screen.4. Canon PowerShot SD1200 - Had 5 months - Washed into the ocean (100% boyfriend's fault)5. Canon PowerShot SD1300 IS - Had 1.5 years - Giant fuzzy black spot started appearing on the screen gradually.  It was so faint at first that it wasn't a big deal, but now it's so dark it makes people look like they don't have heads in photos.  Very scary.6. Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS - Currently own.So two of these problems I will completely take fault for, but the rest of them just kind of randomly happened over time.  As a result, even though I love these cameras and have been incredibly loyal to Canon for a long time, I'm not sure I can continue to afford purchasing a new camera every year.  Beautiful camera and great pictures, but not durable.

Reviews.Title: strange orange/ yellowish color cast
Reviews.Author: Jen C.
Reviews.Content: Small compact camera, but unfortunately the adjustment buttons are hard to push ( i dont have large fingers ) and the image quality is lacking. I have gone through an SD870IS, SD890IS, SD300, SD450 so this is my 5th Canon compact. The picture quality, maybe due to CMOS instead of CCD, is definitely NOT as good as the previous 4 models I had. In addition, in auto mode, I often get a very yellowish picture. Software issue? Processing issue? Very frustrating. Even Photoshop has a hard time undoing the color damage. I took the camera back to where I bought it and tested out 3 other ELPH 100HS's and same thing: yellow color cast, given the right conditions.On the pro side - the flash adjusts itself well for closeup shots, as to not over expose.

Reviews.Title: Not very impressed
Reviews.Author: carol in austin
Reviews.Content: Bought a couple of years ago just to keep handy in purse and didn't expect it to be an awesome camera.  But I did expect better quality photos. The motion stabilizer isn't great.  The "covers" for battery and usb port are so very flimsy and cumbersome to operate and I don't have large hands.  Most recently I was replacing the battery, in trying to get the cover to close, it jammed and I cannot for the life of me get it to open.  I'll have to resort to taking it to camera repair and most likely pay half of the purchase price to get it unjammed.  Not happy witih this product overall.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: A. Sitzmann "Will's Mom"
Reviews.Content: I use my point and shoot a lot and generally replace every 2 years. I decided to go a little lower end this time and get the ELPH 100 HS. I don't use all of the bells and whistles and decided to try to save some money.I read the reviews and many people mentioned the strap. I didn't think it would be a big deal, but not I understand. I have no idea how I could ever get it connected and it's very stiff. I'd switch the one from my old camera if I was keeping the 100 HS. The circle toggle button is so flat, it's hard to push. I have tiny hands and it's awkward and the final staw... no panaoramic! Ouch. Why didn't I think of that before I ordered? I shoot EVERYTHING in panoramic. Love it and can't live without it. Which is ok, because I could live with that toggle button! This will be my 5th digital, 4th Canon. I like them, I know them, and they are simple to use. I found the menus much more difficult to find what use to be easy.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for girls
Reviews.Author: Zhuangzhang
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend as her birthday gift, and she loves it.Really small,friendly interface,affordable price.Perfect gift for girls!!

Reviews.Title: Beware
Reviews.Author: Douglas Ricker
Reviews.Content: Do not buy this camera. Check it out for the many many people that report the same and on going problem of the lens errors.The lens will extend but will not retract. Cannon says this is because you dropped the camera ect.I didn't drop mine. I didn't get it full of sand. I didn't do anything to it and I have experienced exactly what I found others said.The camera worked great for a short time. Then one day I picked it up; turned it on; the lens extended and that was it. I have tried all the known methods to try to get it to go back but it will not.Repairing the camera cost almost what it costs to buy a new one. I will buy a new one but will never buy a Cannon again.BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: DEFECTIVE
Reviews.Author: VirginiaKessler-Bunt
Reviews.Content: I am still trying to get a resolution! I got the camera, took it out, charged up the battery, took a few shots and the lens jammed. I tried to contact seller for a resolution but was curtly told that because the product was opened (and HOW would I know if it was defective if I hadn't tried it???!!!) that I could not send it back or get my money back! HELP!!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: ISANDY
Reviews.Content: This is quite a neat and colorful and powerful camera. It Can easily fit into your pocket. Takes great pictures and videos

Reviews.Title: Amazon Specs. Incorrect
Reviews.Author: Clark Kent "Snowman"
Reviews.Content: The details on Amazon tell us that you can zoom while you are using the video feature with this camera.  Not so.I returned the camera. (Not the camera's error....)

Reviews.Title: Good first camera
Reviews.Author: K. Cespedes
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter going off to college. She loves it. Easy to use, good pictures, and a good size!

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware: Don't Waste Your Money!
Reviews.Author: gsrbfr
Reviews.Content: They do not tell you anywhere until you get it home and read the manual that you can only record 10 minute videos. That is complete BS. It does not matter if you reduce the quality, the video recording shuts off at exactly 10 minutes. Okay, to everyone in engineering of this product, WTF. Who do you think is only going to want to record short 10 minute videos. This is junk."

Reviews.Title: I am returning...
Reviews.Author: Deborah L. Tucker
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple point and shoot camera that took decent quality pictures and was fairly easy to use.  This camera did not have any of these qualities.  The pictures I took were washed out.  The camera menu was not simple.  You have to push down on the button very hard and hold it to take a picture and then it takes so long for the photo to actually shoot that your subject has moved.  I was very disappointed and am returning immediately.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy
Reviews.Author: R. F. Nyeholt
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with the camera's quick shutter and great video capability.  Unfortunately, after using it 3 1/2 months the view finder quick working.  It's past the warrenty so I'm stuck with an expensisive, usesless camera.

Reviews.Title: Need better instructions
Reviews.Author: samiam
Reviews.Content: The instruction book images do not match those on the camera. Thus you are forced to learn the camera operation by trial and error.

Reviews.Title: Internal Damage
Reviews.Author: Jody
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased as a Christmas gift for my daughter who is going to study abroad this semester.  Unfortunately, when she used it prior to her leaving the country, the shutter got stuck and she got an error message.  She contacted the Canon support line & we had to mail it back to them for repair.  Very disappointing for her.  The support person told her it was most likely an internal problem.  We will now have to ship it to her overseas once we receive it.  Overall, we are all disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Like the new camera
Reviews.Author: KEISHA DAVIS
Reviews.Content: I like the camera, just need to develop the pictures!! but it's not that user friendly! I sometimes forget which button to use to get the picture bigger or even to delete. So I will update once I pring some pictures!

Reviews.Title: Christmas Gift
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: Canon Power Shot ELPH100 HS was bought for a Christmas gift,but my wife talked me into giving it to her early,she loves it.

Reviews.Title: It can do the job...
Reviews.Author: Jill DePass
Reviews.Content: If you are just looking for a very, very easy to use, simple camera, your set. BUT don't let the sample pictures fool you, my camera doesn't nearly have the good of quality and it is in perfect condition. My recommendation is keep looking, its not very good..

Reviews.Title: canon elph 100
Reviews.Author: don
Reviews.Content: [ great camera they only trouble is you can not see a image on the screen ,on a bright sunny day .i don car what setting you but it on the screen shows no picture.if canon put a pop up view finder on this camera they would sell millions.If they do make one with a view finder let me know.i will be one of the first to buy one.http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004J3V828/ref=cm_cr_rev_prod_title

Reviews.Title: How the heck do you attach the wrist strap!
Reviews.Author: Fizz "Fizz - book lover"
Reviews.Content: Just rcvd the camera last night, and will report back after using it.  It looks like a great little camera.  I'm currently charging the battery but spent too much time last night trying to attach the wrist strap - finally gave up.  What's the secret, people?

Reviews.Title: Flash is too strong
Reviews.Author: J. Lederer
Reviews.Content: My only complaint is that the flash is simply way too strong. All pictures taken using the flash washes out the persons face. I've been in several situations where I've had to take spur of the moment pictures only to discover that my subjects face was completely unrecognizable and washed out due to the powerful flash. Every camera can take good pictures in the day. The mark of a good camera is how well it can take pics in low-lighting situations. This one fails. I plan on returning it.

Reviews.Title: Broken :(
Reviews.Author: Baby Krause
Reviews.Content: I would love this camera if it worked, very light, very simple.Charged battery and tried to take pictures but it had a black blur dot on the pictures plus the skin on everyone looked yellow/green :( Had to send it back for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Cannon Camera
Reviews.Author: Gloria G. White
Reviews.Content: This camera is very nice. Received it very quickly.I haven't used it as yet because it didn't come with a memory card or instructions.  However I know I will really get a lot of use out of it.

Reviews.Title: Not a Canon standard camera
Reviews.Author: itzMe_Prasad
Reviews.Content: I thought of buying a CMOS sensor based camera for low light indoor photography, but i am not satisfied by the picture quality, the basic details are missing in the images. The image size varies between 1.5MB to 3MB, which itself states that the picture details are missing due to lossy compression for a 12MP camera model. CMOS sensor is better in compared to CCD said by experts, but same scene i captured in EPLH100(CMOS) and Sony W530(CCD) the Sony wins the race. After this i am really doubting the CANON CMOS capability. I thought of buying the SX40IS but i really doubt on CANON ability over Sony HX100v and Panasonic FZ150.Please avoid buying the ELPH series rather think of the these: Fuji F550,Canon 230HS, Sony WX9v, Nikon S8100 which are almost close to this range.

Reviews.Title: lIKES AND DISLIKES
Reviews.Author: aramig
Reviews.Content: I like the camera because it's smaller than the newer models.What I don't like is the fact that I could have bought the camera from FRY's for FIFTY dollars cheaper.

Reviews.Title: would have been a 5 star product if a manuel had been included
Reviews.Author: The Bee
Reviews.Content: Wonderful camera.  But for some odd reason, Amazon chose not to send the owners manuel with the camera.  Strange, as I had to look it up on line and download 212pages of manuel.  Would have LOVED to have the manuel to take with us as we aren't always going to be able to access the computer when shooting pictures with the camera.  Printing 212 pages is a bit expensive and bulky as well.  Why Amazon did not include the manuel for a product of this value and complexity is very strange.  But the product is a great product indeed.  Again, we would have given the product five stars if we had a manuel.Another strange thing is that there was no option for seller's feedback for this item.  Strange again.

Reviews.Title: Just out of the box & it's going  back.
Reviews.Author: CottageGardener
Reviews.Content: I usually make an effort to try something before I write a review, but this time that's not necessary.First of all, how are you supposed to HOLD this camera without putting your thumb RIGHT on the screen?  Oh...the wrist strap?  Yeah, right. I've done needlepoint that was easier than getting the wrist strap attached. Finally gave up.Disappointed - kept reading all of these great reviews and was looking forward to owning this camera.

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: This was a very poor camera. The photos it took were routinely blurry, and they lacked the crispness that would be expected for a camera with this many megapixels. Overall, not a good purchase, and it is going back to the store.

Reviews.Title: Sorry to purchase
Reviews.Author: Mohamad Pashazadeh
Reviews.Content: I am sorry to buy this item. It does not work properly. the pictures are not clear. The video camera breaks the sequence.

Reviews.Title: No memory card included.
Reviews.Author: Amateur "Ed D."
Reviews.Content: The camera seems to be as good as the Canon Power shot that I bought many years ago but I cannot tell for sure because I cannot transfer the photos to my computer without the memory card. Hence, the one-star rating.An interface cable is supplied so an amateur photographer such as myself would reasonably assume that he could transfer his photos to his computer to be edited and stored. Nowhere in the LONG description (which is meant more for experienced users than for amateurs such as myself) does it say that you cannot transfer your photos to your computer without a memory card in place. Can I print photos from the camera? After all, this is a "point and shoot" camera meant for John Q.Public. The memory card offered for sale next to the camera implies that you can have more storage if you buy the card in addition to the camera. It does NOT say that it is a necessity if you want to do anything with your photos besides look at them on the camera's screen. All that being said, it is reasonable to assume that the camera is ready to go when taken out of the box. Maybe Canon's PR people are not looking at these negative customer ratings.

Reviews.Title: Piece of crap.  Broke on first day.  Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Jon Nuger
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife for her birthday.  Camera took 4 pictures and immediately broke on first day (screen just kept saying "Lens Error" and camera would not turn on again).  Now have to go through the painful process of invoking warranty, sending back to manufacturer, waiting however many weeks.  I have historically had good experiences with Canon products, but this one is a piece of garbage unfortunately.  Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: no memory card
Reviews.Author: D. Chambers
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today and it doesn't work without a memory card and none comes with it so I don't know how it works but looks like if something is required, they would include it with the camera
